The gate was definitely cool to see. Fun area! Always interesting to see how Chinatowns in different cities carry such unique and authentic feels in their own way.
I wouldn't make a trip just to see the gate itself, but if you go through it into Chinatown, there are many great shops to get food and unique/culturally specific items

name: Harvard Art Museums
reviews: The museum is very clean and organized. The selection of art (my wife is interested in art, me...sort of) was varied and interesting, with a large selection of beautiful paintings, sculpture and historical pieces. The security team there is very friendly and helpful....front desk staff not so much but it was one person acting that way and I'm sure there are many other helpful employees here. Still 5 stars as my wife had  a wonderful time!

Really friendly and young staff who enjoys being there! I got in for free with my international student ID which is fantastic. Only thing I would have appreciated more is a clear starting and ending point or a chronologically laid out itinerary

Fantastic art museum... Comparable to the Museum of Fine Arts. Some outstanding pieces including Monet and stuff. Came here with my Brazilian friend and she loves it too. We had free entrance cause we are students. 5/5 stars would def recommend...

Great place.  If you are in the area worth to stop by and explore the art exhibits. There is an entrance fee of $20 for the general public. Not sure of there is a student or senior discount. They also have lockers to store your items. Museum is a good size but u can get thru in couple of hours depending on how much of an art fan u are !
Great collection. The coinage exhibit is worth your time. Spent a relaxed 2 1/2 hours there. I'll go back.

name: LEGOLAND Discovery Center Boston
reviews: It's a great day trip with the kiddo. We have so much fun creating!! It's busiest in the middle of the day. Lines were nothing later on after dinner! And a ton of the little bag Lego have a coupon on the back so your kid gets in for free with one full price adult ticket! It's worth it! Plus you get more Lego!!! TIP toronto is bigger than here

It's a great day trip with the kiddo. We have so much fun creating!! It's busiest in the middle of the day. Lines were nothing later on after dinner! And a ton of the little bag Lego have a coupon on the back so your kid gets in for free with one full price adult ticket! It's worth it! Plus you get more Lego!!!

Good place to entertain kids on an afternoon or a morning. It is not really big but can keep kids entertained 2-3 hours. The 4D cinema experience is fun. The rides also appeals to all kids. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is surprisingly clean and well ventilated even though it can be rather crowded in the weekends. The Boston Lego display is very cool and gives you ideas. The regular entry fee is expensive, look for coupons or sales. The annual pass is a better option if you live in the area.

Great place to go to on a cold or rainy day. Plenty of stuff to keep kids occupied. We spent almost 5 hours bouncing around from one thing to another. The extra $5 for the activity pack keeps them even more entertained. More than reasonable priced to get in too.

Very cool LEGO display of Boston. Fun place for a snowy evening with the kids. Small although each area keeps the kids attention for at least an hour...or more. As a parent time can creep slowly as it’s small and limited things to do. And no windows. All in all we had fun!

name: Boston Massacre Site
address: Corner of State and, Congress St, Boston, MA 02109, USA
reviews: Walked the freedom trail and the walk may not be for people who are not used to walking a few miles. The historical sites are fascinating to visit and there is so much History in the Boston area. I would definitely recommend a visit for the family. Summer can be a bit humid, so make sure you have enough water when walking through the city.

The place marks the beginning of American Revolution. The trail walks you through most of the historic places in Boston and places which led to American Revolution. It's a must visit location and especially for people who are enthusiastic about history.
Best time to visit - summer/fall!

You must book a tour that includes this historical event to really appreciate it. If you do not then you be standing in front of a marker that represent an 18th century event without its context.
In such a case, pay a visit to the buildings in the area that have a lot of history to tell also.
250 years ago this spot marks the beginning of the American revolution. Actors are volunteers.  Important stop on the freedom trail.

One of the coolest places to see on the Freedom Trail. We exited the near by subway on our first day in Boston and we're standing on the spot of the massacre and didn't realize it because we were trying to figure out where we were. Not important, but I thought it was funny.

name: Symphony Hall
reviews: Boston Symphony is a very old and nice place to just visit. The architecture is adorable. I felt like I am in a museum with these amazing statues all around the salon. The waiting salons have old pictures of the pianists, which are very nostalgic. It is nice to see while drinking the wine. I really enjoyed listening Tchaikovsky violin concerto in this fascinating salon.

There are a variety of wonderful performances here. The staff are friendly and helpful. It's no small feat to create a formal atmosphere but to remain inviting. The hall has fantastic acoustics and gorgeous architecture. I love this place!
This concert hall has amazing acoustics. Also nicely set up so it doesn't feel too crowded either in the corridors, or in the seating. More toilet facilities would be nice, however!

Great old concert hall in Boston. The acoustics are amazing and there is not a bad seat in the house. I have been to a few shows here and always enjoyed the atmosphere. Everybody is friendly and the concerts are always amazing! Highly recommend!

Seating for Pops concerts is VERY crowded, but show was SPECTACULAR!  They definitely have fun and put you in the Christmas spirit.  Their version of The 12 Days of Christmas is both funny and amazing.  Great for a family event. Food served at tables is of generous portions.

name: St. Leonard of Port Maurice Parish
reviews: A beautiful Church,and what an outstanding praying ground's walk through and enjoy such beautiful religious art work, statues, nice place to sit down relax and enjoy, pray 🙏 to Lord, for just about anything, forgiveness, prayers for friends and family etc. I could on. Go there and enjoy.when your at Mike's Pastry on Hanover St North end of Boston. Corner of prince and Hanover. Enjoy.watch the kids play b-ball on the side of the church.🙏

Beautiful church, open gates to welcome all to come pray. Candles to light, and mass is delivered in English and Italian. 
Where my grandparents exchanged vows to begin what became 72, beautiful and bonded years of love and devotion until they were separated by death to reunite in heaven. 
Tourists or a local, come to say a prayer, or honor a loved one. Or just see the beauty!
St. Leonard's is a beautiful church. There are plenty of saints to pray to. It is open during the week to light candles and pray. The Sunday mass at 12 is great for locals and tourists.

I love St. Leonard's Church. The service on Sunday is wonderful for local families and tourists. The saints are there to pray to. It is also a great place to go on any day to light a candle for a loved one. I highly recommend.

This church is really beautiful. Very ornate and well lit. It can seem unassuming from the outside but once you walk inside you will be amazed. The gardens outside are always meticulously kept. Worth a stop in.

name: Samuel Adams Statue
reviews:
Pretty interesting spot. It's right next to some indoor markets / food courts so it's a great spot to check out for lunch. 

The food court is not mall style with popular brands. It's all independent vendors with some super unique offerings.

I loved all the old buildings and sense of history here. Wish I would have had more time to explore. I especially would have loved to have had a beer in one of the taverns that have been around since revolutionary times!
Great landmark but no free beer.
Great location for statue. Right next to Faneuil Hall and incidentally the Sam Adams Tap Room!

Great place to hang out, can watch some wonderful people showcasing their talent,  wide variety of interesting things to see,  eat and buy! Especially enjoyed the performance of a young boy who sang and played the guitar. Watch out for the video..Soul stirring!

name: Old South Meeting House
reviews: Historically beautiful interesting for adults , lame for children . Admission fee is reasonable . Pick one of the churches and visit our of the three. We visited all three and they all were the same . Look from outside at the other two. But the old north , church , Kings chapel , and old south meeting place interiors are pretty much the same. Yes each place has a different significants but inside they are alike. For a family on a budget one of the three is good enough for the interior.

Since 1877, The Old South Association in Boston has preserved the 1729 Old South Meeting House as a busy museum, treasured landmark, and an active center for civic dialogue and free expression. A must for a visit to Boston. Learn the valuable part it played in the formation of the nation.

A historical and beautiful building. It's actually a cool place for a wedding. Did you know that this was where the original Boston Tea Party plot started and the British retaliated by turning it into a riding school?
Well worth visiting whilst you’re doing the freedom trail. This building, much like Boston itself, is steeped in history!

Great exhibits and knowledgeable information, and it was in the perfect location when walking through town. I loved the exhibits, the staff, and restorations and the preservation at this museum. They close at 4pm, so we didn't have a lot of time there, but it was worth it for the time we were there

name: Castle Island
address: 2010 William J Day Blvd, Boston, MA 02127, USA
reviews:
Great views!
Great ‘getaway’ from normal daily stress.
Great for ‘people watching’, checking planes coming and going from airport across the bay.
You must get something at Sullivan’s; great prices and selection of food.
Beach if you want.

My first visit to Castle Island was on a cloudy wet afternoon. While the weather was typically poor, as you might expect on a January day, I could still see this was a gem of a location. I plan to come back in the spring. 

There are beautiful walking path, some nice beach areas, and a lovely view of Boston Harbor. there's also a good prospect of Logan airport, you can watch the planes take off and land.

There is a small children's playground, bathrooms that are open in the summer season, and a snack bar as well. An ideal place to spend a beautiful day. Even in the midst of drizzle and mist I greatly enjoyed walking along the paths and appreciating the sea breeze.

The Boston Korean War Memorial is also located here. It's a wonderful little Monument right on the shores of Boston Harbor. To get there you take a short walk from the parking area around the outskirts of Fort Independence, to the east side right along the water's edge.
What a great way to spend time to get some rest and relaxation. This is the best way to get some walking in. The view is breathe taking. The walking path is great and you can meet the locals.
Love it here.  Beautiful place to go for a walk/run. Bring your dogs for a walk. You can watch the planes come in.

There's no better place to go outside in the summer! Get some grub at Sullys, walk around enjoying the constant (almost) breeze....playground for the kids AND a small beach so THEY love it.... It wouldn't be summer without Castle Island!

name: Trinity Church
reviews: One of the best architecture for a church. The church gets lit in the evening. The architecture looks very ancient yet astonishingly beautiful. Best time to visit the church is before sunset. Although we did not get a chance to see the inside, I can only imagine how good could it be.

Omg. No words! I was in awe the whole time there.  The audio tour is great...not boring, but fascinating! I'd love to go to a service. The alter and the dome around it is stunning and so much history! It's beautiful on the outside at night, a must see and photo opportunity.  The stained glass of Jesus at the front of the church is a must see. It tranquilized me. I prayed for a bit. So moving.

Very Beautiful architecture. When we visited the organ player was practicing and it was so cool. We only had a very quick visit but it’s well worth a look. 
Coming off the busy streets to a beautiful serene environment is wonderful.

We went here for Christmas Eve service and really enjoyed it. There were predictions of long lines to get in but we only waited about 10 minutes. The church is lovely; quaint and historic. We sang old-school hymns from the hymnal and the priest's message was spot-on. Really enjoyed the whole experience.

I walked by this church so many times before going in and realizing what great historical value it has (starting with the foundation). I was really impressed with all the details on the inside and how much more colorful it was than I was expecting it to be. It is cheap admission and we'll kept, so I would recommend it as a quick trip to anyone that is in the area and has not seen it yet.

name: Warren Anatomical Museum
address: Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine, 10 Shattuck St, Boston, MA 02115, USA
reviews: Loved all the amazing exhibits and information about the medical history of Harvard Medical School.
Much smaller than expected. Amazing, no doubt.. just wish there was more.
A random part of history on display. The eagle skeleton is top notch.
this is really only five displays around the fifth floor elevator. if you're Ajay there it's definitely worth checking out, DON'T walk ½ mile in the rain to see it though
just one floor in a stuffy Harvard library full of squares. no real decaying arm. i am tragically disappointed and you Will be hearing fron me soon.

name: The Greenway Carousel
address: Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston, MA 02114, USA
reviews: My daughter and I absolutely love the Greenway Carousel. Children love to ride on it and adults seem to like the music that plays. It is definitely busy on weekends when there is nice weather. Still there is barely a wait. It costs $4 per ride and 10 for $30. It is a fun activity for sure.

Cheap, fun entertainment just around the corner from Fanuiel Hall Marketplace. It has beautiful views of the surrounding Green Space that was the former home of the less pleasant looking Central Artery. Encourage people to take time out of their visit to Boston to use this time to chill and enjoy the time to reflect on what's around you.

We hit up the ‘ol carousel almost every day we were in town (long weekend visit) and had a blast. Definitely buy the 10 pack of tickets and save a few bucks if your kids like to go 3-4 times a day like mine! The music and the nostalgia the spinning gives you is totally worth it. Also, it’s not nauseatingly fast spinning. It’s on the mellow side of things while maintaining the fun factor. Recommend!

Beautiful carousel for $3 a ride and parents can go with the kids.

Good to see different varieties of animals to ride on along with some great choice of music.

One request to the organizers if they can add belts on the rides for safety purposes.

I asked my 8 yo what her favorite thing was about visiting Boston and it was this Carousel! I've never seen a carousel with butterflies and hawks but its very nice and has a lot of character. Each ride is $4 or you can get 10 tickets for $30, so bring a few friends or buy a few rides.

name: Fort Warren
reviews: Loved this place.  Boat cruise cost $20 round trip and we had plenty of time to walk around the island.  They had free guided tours.  3 options for guided tours which took you to different parts.  Staff there are very friendly. Unique items at the gift shop and visitor center.  Fort Warren is built uniquely and has a lot of unique views.
Very cool fort with lots of plaques of information and many areas to explore within the fort. Don't forget to bring a flashlight!

This place is SUCH a good price for a great experience. Round trip ferry ride gives you great views of Boston and the harbor. Then, the fort itself is wonderful to explore, even with kids. There are places to picnic and bathrooms as well. I went two weekends in a row!
Great place to explore a piece of Boston history.  It is worth taking a tour with a guide.  Stairs to the ramparts do not have hand rails. That part not recommended for small children

Nice outdoor space. It is a short ferry ride to George's Island. Bring a flash light in order to fully explore the fort. Be sure to catch one of the many tours of the island provided by the National Park Service Guides. You'll learn a lot of interesting facts, they do a great job.

name: Black Heritage Trail
reviews: Great little walk through, but hard to spot at first. The scenery is beautiful and much needed historic gem for our city. As well for our country too!
Took the guided tour with Amelia and it was fantastic! Great guide, full of interesting information and incredibly friendly/helpful to everyone on the tour, couldn't fault it/her!
Difficult to do bcause there are no signs for navigation.  You do not know where to go and there is not much documentation abour the trail .  The scenery is very nice and it`s a nice place to walk.

I love the idea, but there are few historic plaques/markers and nearly all the buildings are private. There is very little tour literature. With a little bit of improvement, this could be a really good learning experience.
Very nice, a little hard to find, but worth the trip

name: Leonard P. Zakim Bunker Hill Memorial Bridge
reviews: Beautiful Bridge To Cross. A True Boston Landmark And An Icon Of Boston. Beautifully Made And At Night Depending On The Day / Holiday The Bridge Glows In Color. Traffic Jams Up But Its Normal Since It Is Boston. Nothing To Do About It. A True Sheen Of Beauty And Well Worth Whatever Toll Is To Be Paid. Make Sure Your Cross This Bridge Wherever You May Go. Its A Sight To Awe About And Enjoy And Depending On Your Location In Boston It Is Fairly Visible. An Enjoyment To Behold

The Leonard P. Zakim Bunker Hill Memorial Bridge is one of the widest cable-stayed bridges in the world. The Bridge serves as the northern entrance to and exit from Boston. The Bridge is named after civil rights activist Lenny Zakim and the American colonists who fought the British in the Battle of Bunker Hill. 
There are several parks on every side of the river, and a nice walking overpass that allows you going under the bridge and crossing from one side to the other.

This is a beautiful bridge, very well constructed. The veiw at night time is amazing. There is also a small skate park located under the bridge in case you would be interested in skating with a veiw. The traffic is not too bad and is pretty regulated. I definitely recommend taking this route

The Zakimin Boston,MA.
 I always love driving over this beautiful land mark.An absolutely must see day and night. Guaranteed to feel like a true Bostonian after experiencing the wondrous sites from this historical bridge.

We only got a chance to view the bridge during the day and it's a pretty spectacular bridge.  I had no idea who Leonard P. Zakim was without a Google search. I've seen the night photos and can't wait to go back and view the bridge with the lights on.  Kudos on a great bridge Boston!

name: Fort Independence
address: 2010 William J Day Blvd, Boston, MA 02127, USA
reviews: This is a place I’ll definitely come back to, mostly because I missed the tour. Was so upset about that. It’s a beautiful place, surrounded by the Boston Harbor with crisp, clean air and a place to eat, as well as several monuments, a walking trail, and a park for kids to play. If you’re in Boston, it’s a must see.

A great place to walk and, think clearly. Watch the airplanes. A wonderful place to watch the sunrise and, 🙌marvel at God's Creation for us. Thanks to all the people who work so hard overseeing and maintaining the beach and, grounds and bathrooms, keeping them flawless and clean. Thanks to Sullivan's for a marvelous summer. Blessings to you🙏 we appreciate you all.

The tour was fun, free and short. Made it through the top of the fort and saw the cannons and back out, in just a half hour. The scenery from the top is gorgeous. The tours run on weekends at the top of every hour from 12-3pm.
Right now (march 2020) it is closed. It opens in may. It is a historical site but not much to see.

Basically,
This guy came up to me and asked for help for a settlement. I did it and then came back. He said it again and I helped once again. It came to where I was repeating this. He then told me to kill all the crabs in the fort and the take it for the "Minutemen". He also called those crabs Mirelurks. Anyway when I completed his last mission he sent me to help the same settlement I already helped. So I shot him and now all the "Minutemen" are "Permanently My Enemy". I liked the Artillery though.

name: Boston Fire Museum
reviews: Really nice museum with 2 fire engines, one of which you can sit on, lots of old firemens helmets, the possibly unique to Boston, fire  alarms, which can be viewed internally, and other artifacts pertaining to the Service. Staffed by retired firemen who are very happy to to answer questions.

You just have to love a fire station museum. You can feel the bravery of the men and women who worked here saving life's and putting out fires. Not open every day but a must see in Boston. And I bought the t-shirt. Thanks to the ex fire fighter volunteers who look after this place and are happy to talk about the exhibits.
I never knew this place existed until I went to my son's classmate birthday party. It's a pretty small and cozy place. The staffs seemed pretty nice. I definitely recommend it.
Free admission. Lots of cool history and memorabilia. Donations accepted.
The fire museum is an awesome place to visit. There are tons of displays inside and the guys that work there are very knowledgable and willing to help.

name: Old South Church
reviews: UCC Old South has progressive Theology, great hospitality, excellent music, and choir, beautiful building. After visited over ten churches, I finally have found Old South as the most recommended Church in Boston.

Such an amazing place.
The History and Architecture of the Building. Simply Stunning 😍
I go to my AA recovery meeting twice a week. It helps keep me loving life.!
Such a beautiful church with such rich history. If you're in Boston for the marathon, visit for the "blessing of the athletes" services. A MUST see.
This is my home church.  I really like the fact that this is a church with open doors and open hearts.  Anyone, whether he or she believes in God or not, is welcome here.

name: Saltie Girl
reviews:
Amazing vibe but gets packed really fast. Nice staff and fast and attentive service. The food is pricey and it's easy to get caught up ordering more but it's worth it. 
Food is delicious as well.

Small but great restaurant. The Boston salad is lightly dressed but great flavor. The warm lobster roll is amazing! Nicely buttered. Would definitely return. Other menu items looked great such as the torched salmon belly, snow crab bread, etc.
The warm Lobster Roll 🦞 was delicious! Had to have one while visiting Boston; glad I chose Saltie Girl. Enjoyed a lovely dinner with my daughter. Would definitely return/recommend.

Literally one of my favorite restaurants for a lobster roll. I've never had a bad meal here. They can be really busy, but the customer service here is great, even when dining solo. Love this place! Gotta visit again soon!

Ended up here on the recommendation of a retail worker down the street and was not disappointed. We got the grand seafood tower and everything was amazing. My boyfriend asked for something non-alcoholic and got a delicious guava drink. We also opted for the truffle cauliflower and were not disappointed. Definitely recommend!

name: Mistral
reviews:
Amazing food, amazing service... had a great time!

Ordered mussels for apps, the broth was superb.
The French onion soup was great, not too cheesy, just right.
Ordered the sole fish, very good flavor.
...and for desserts, had the warm chocolate cake... everything was great.

Really great place.  Very lively atmosphere.  If you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner, this may not be the best choice as it can be quite noisy & seating is tight.  You will likely be seated quite close to others. We have dined here 3 times now and every meal has been top notch. It's not inexpensive, so be prepared, but you get what you pay for.

I just went there with my 3 girls for a birthday celebration and this place was unbelievably good. very elegant and food was delicious. it was exactly the type of atmosphere we were looking for very formal classy. Love it and will def go back.

Beautiful, warm ambience. The presentation was gorgeous. Everything was delicious starting with the warm Semolina bread followed by a strange but delicious Lamb's lettuce salad with goat cheese, and finally the amazing Grilled tenderloin with whipped horseradish potatoes. Sadly no room for dessert so perhaps we will start with it next time 😉
Pricy but excellent food & service! Tenderloin steak is really great. Garlic spinach is exceptional great; it replaces my potato. Enjoy every moment of it!

name: Sorellina
reviews: This is a lovely, intimate restaurant tucked among the hotels surrounding Copley Square. Service is attentive and warm, tables are spaced well, and noise level is just right for fine dining. The food is excellent, some of the best I've had in Boston. Pastas are hand made and delicious, meats are well sourced and prepared beautifully. Desserts are innovative. Spirits selection is well curated, and drinks are well balanced. Only down mark would be the bar staff attitude. We started our evening with a cocktail at the bar, and most staff seemed distant and arrogant, and didn't match the warm welcoming attitude of the front and wait staff. While the restaurant was full during our meal, the bar seats were empty, and this was not surprising. Take note, Sorellina.

The gnocchi is to die for. It’s a lumps of lobster meat or a light buttery sauce. The arugula salad is good as well. Bartenders are extremely friendly. Ambiance is nice as well. Good place to sit at the bar if you’re alone. The limo be dessert is so delicious. I’m typically not as fan of fruity desserts but this one is amazing.

The food, the atmosphere, the staff, wine selection, everything is great! Delicious! The place was packed on Saturday night but you still get fast service and attention from the personnel. Great food, great place to have a delicious and filling dinner. Highly recommended.

Sorellina's is finally off my bucket list of restaurants to try! Reservations is definitely required but I lucked out as a walk in due to a cancellation. Service was very attentive from the Bus Boy to the Waiter. Wine menu is more intensive than the food menu but don't be fool. Overall it met the expectations both in my head and hear say.

The complementary bread was warm and came with a light flavored soft butter. In addition, the free starter, razor clam, was cooked perfectly. I don't ordered razor clam dishes in western style food restaurants since the shells and sand are very hard to clean. However, the razor clam here only came with the mellow meat part and the sour taste increased my appetite.

name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery
reviews: The service was impeccable and the food was great! Filet mignon was also yummy and the lobster Mac and cheese was also delicious. Will defiantly go back!!! Best service and food thus far.

Pricey, but delicious. “In fashioned” cocktail was   one of the best we’ve had in awhile.  Steaks were perfectly cooked, tender, and flavorful. Waitstaff Molly was fantastic, perfect level of friendly and attention - give her a raise!

If you want the best of the best, you go here. They had a nice romantic spot for my girlfriend and I. Celebrating her birthday. The drinks were great and the food was worth the price. They actually accidentally clear the table before we were done eating. So they apologized and remade both of our entire meals to go. Excellent service.

Have been here maybe around 10 times or so over the years, especially around Dine Out Boston times. It's always been fantastic - the vibe, the quality of food, and the services.

This year's experience was slightly underwhelming, but they definitely took care of it in the end. Just wanted to share this input for the restaurant more than anything, and anyone who may doubt this place.

This visit, the mains were pretty underwhelming. Fresh peppers were super spicy for some reason, never like before. One of our steaks was seared on the outside, and raw in the middle (not rare or medium rare, but raw as in uncooked, tough). All of the steaks were very underseasoned. I imagine it was due to handling an abnormal volume of steaks this time around. They tried to cook the uncooked beef a little more, but burned the steak on the outside this time in doing so. We didn't said anything and just let it go at that point, knowing the situation. But, they certainly took care of us afterwards - asked if we desired anything additional meanwhile, providing us additional warm sides, and not charging for that steak in the end. Gave the tip based on the original price for all of the food ordered regardless because that was fantastic service. Thank you!
4.5 - 4.75 stars ~ Great selection of breads. Service is great. Steak is well prepared and taste great. Much better than the other steakhouse close by.

name: Atlantic Fish Co
reviews: Very pleasant waitress. Rafaela was helpful and answered any questions we had. Very nice. Service was quick. Food was excellent!  Wife and I had the lobster that was seasoned perfectly in a great sauce. Would go back again without a doubt!

We rushed in at the last minute without a reservation and was immediately seated for lunch. We explained to Karla, our waitress, that we were in huge rush and needed to dine quickly; with the rush, our lunch was still delicious. The calamari was wonderfully prepared and was the best we have tasted. The lemonade was both refreshingly tarty and sweet.

Starting with the bread to the main course everything was great. The bread was so soft and it also was served with a blueberry muffin which was also very good. The steamed mussels were super tasty. We also had the New England Clam Chowder in the bread bowl (a must). Texture, flavor and consistency was perfect. The lobster roll was good too.

We had lunch on  Saturday with a large group,15! They accommodated us at a table of 11 and a table of 4 right next to them. It was a busy day so we were happy to seated immediately. The menu is great. Great soups salads and sandwiches for a mid-day meal. The lobster bisque was amazing with huge chunks of lobster in a wonderful creamy broth. A must have. The other 2 bests were their lobster roll, stuffed with huge chunks of lobster and their crab sandwich similarly filled with crab..As good as the food was the service was even better. Nicholas our server was a fun and attentive server. he made the dining experience complete. Go here you will not be disappointed!
Fresh and delicious seafood! Great upscale restaurant that was family friendly. Their infused ice tea was phenomenal! Great ambiance and very busy. My kids loved the kids menu. Lots to choose from.

name: Davio's Northern Italian Steakhouse
reviews: We ate at Davio's before at different location and we didn't think it was good. This time we go there because we have a gift card so we give a try again. All dishes were good. I have the sea scallops with risotto. It was delicious with good portion. I will go again.

Lunch and dinners here are top notch. They do a great job on sides and main dishes alike. Good atmosphere for couples, small groups, and family event dining. Love their steaks, and their portions are spot on. In other Davio's locations, I have seen their desert carts, and all of their pastries and fruit and cream based dishes were fabulous, even worthy of the being sampled at the best of the North End bakeries.

I have been to their Chestnut Hill location as well, and their main fare is fabulous at both locations. Parking is doable at the meters and at the surrounding garages. It's also easily accessible from Back Bay, the Theater District, and Chinatown.

If you love Italian, and also want a change of pace, with their Northern Italian menu, check them out. It's really a 4.5 star place.

Family came here for a nice dinner.  The food was spectacular and our server Joe was excellent.  We ordered Kobi meatballs, braised octopus, raw clams, gnocchi, pan seared lobster, lobster risotto and goat cheese tortellini, and all were superb👍

I was in for my birthday and it was really good. The service was amazing and the food as well. Although the waiting line could be long sometimes, and the lack of enough seat for those waiting can be make experience challenging. But overall it is a very good restaurant with a bar and private spaces located at the heart of Boston.

Truly amazing food! I cannot speak highly enough of the staff, service, food quality, food quantity and ambiance. By far my favorite visit to a restaurant in months (and I travel every week for business, and eat out often at this caliper restaurant).

name: Ostra
address: 1 Charles St S, Boston, MA 02116, USA
reviews: This was a truly special experience.  Everything we had vastly exceeded expectations.  All of the seafood was the freshest I've ever had, and the combinations of flavors were very meticulously and artfully executed.  If you don't mind spending a pretty penny, I would highly recommend trying this place.
Food was really good. Room was nice but pretty stark. Staff is GREAT! You have to give them a try! A little pricey but well worth it!

Easily one of the best meals i have had in ages.  The caviar an accompaniments were superb.  The oysters were remarkable, even given being in Boston. The cooked dishes were finished to perfection.  Presentation was excellent.  Staff was attentive though not intruding.  Overall a perfect fine dining experience.  I will return.

I really enjoy Ostra.  A nice place for special occasions.  Good service, nice menu, good bar.

Definitely consider Ostra for a special occasion.

Highly recommended.

I ordered D'Boom Smoothie, which was one of their most popular smoothie. It was quite tasty, nice sweetness from all the fruits, very filling and satisfying. I felt great, and amazing for your body and soul! It was a quite chilly day, so I also ordered one of their homemade soups. I ordered Creamy Tomato Basil Soup as a side order.

name: SRV
reviews:
Everything was AMAZING, the food the place and the service!!
I liked everything we ordered except the pastas it was not as good as I thought it is going to be,  maybe it just needed more salt, other than that every thing else was so delicious!! 
Definitely will come back!
It's a good place to eat with family. The food came out quicker than I expected, and it tasted divine. Good stuff all around. All in all, very tasty.
The food is amazing!! Service was great - friendly and quick. The sparking red wine they have is a must. Would definitely go back here when in Boston.

SRV is a great dining experience in the South End. From start to finish you will enjoy yourselves, from the food to the atmosphere it is all great. 

Reservations are usually necessary on Friday and Saturday, but you might get lucky if you walk in early enough. In the summer they typically have their back patio open, as well as some outdoor street seating, which will open up more tables to choose from. 

The food always impresses, and they update their menus often so you’ll always be able to try something new. Their pasta is absolutely incredible, and they’re very knowledgeable in the melding of seafood into these dishes. Their wine list is also rather extensive, which adds to the experience. The atmosphere is great, modern accents with exposed brick makes for a great combination that is new and inviting. This is a great staple in the South End and I look forward to dining again.
Nice Italian restaurant. The beef raviolis were excellent besides the portion size was a bit small. Highly recommend the tiramisu - it was huge and delicious!

name: O Ya
reviews: The greatest sushi I have ever had. It was a little hard finding the entrance, but once I was inside I loved the vibe. Our waitress was incredibly personable and kind, hostess was sweet, and the food was out-of-this-world. Expensive yes, but undeniably unique. Every small piece of sushi has a crazy number of different flavors, I don't know how they do it. I'd highly recommend doing the beverage pairing along with the chefs tasting.

This restaurant is my first choice site.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. when  I want to go to a fair lunch, this is the place that comes immediately to my mind. best and   food and a rich menu.trained crew, and good mood. And very important, the pay is modest. I praise this spot with no doubt.

This place is certainly one of the coolest restaurants in the area. Anytime I visit this place I am absolutely glad. They preserve their very high  standard service and the highest level of food  they offer. You always win with this place. Highly  recommended.

Amazing experience everytime we go. It is rare that you can dine at a restaurant and find every bite different and exceptional. We have had the grand omakase dinner (~20 courses) eight times now and can truly say that we have had 160 fabulous courses that were handcrafted right before our eyes. Splurge and enjoy!

Came here with my man for his birthday- He did the Grand Omakase and I did the Vegetarian Omakase. Beautiful, delicious. Impeccably plated. The vegetarian options were definitely not a throw away and were how I want to eat vegetables every day. Worth it for a special occasion.

name: Toro Boston
reviews: One of the best restaurants in Boston.  Excellent Spanish tapas restaurant with an excellent bar and outdoor seating.  It does not take reservations, so be prepared to wait.  It’s worth the wait.  Really love the bone marrow and gambas.  However, everything is excellent.

I have been going to Toro since it opened over 10 years ago and love the place. Great place to share tapas and It’s like being in Spain. They do a great job there and have an excellent staff. Best to go for lunch during the week as there is no wait.

This place is incredible. If you are lucky enough to get a reservation for lunch or dinner take it! You could eat here alone or dine with a small group of friends. The atmosphere is slow paced and quiet which is perfect for the food. Completely antitypical American size portions, food, ingredients, etc.

Come here if you're ready to embrace spanish-style, thoughtfully prepared tapas. We came hungry and excited for interesting plates and wines and we left wanting to come back for dinner. Put this on your Boston bucket list if you are visiting or if you need to get out of a rut and live your best life.

Hands down the best Tapas restaurant in Boston. We have been coming to Toro for years and are never disappointed. They do not take reservations, so come with the intention of buying a drink (or two) at the bar while you wait for a table. 

The menu varies slightly by season, and in the summer there is more of a fresh seafood focus. In the winter the dishes are more substantial and focused on the meats. Toro has excellent drinks and very inventive cocktails which are a must try. One of their most popular dishes is the corn, which comes lathered in butter and cheese. (You can order it 'off the cob' if you are not a fan of eating corn on the cob). 

Never disappointed, always leave happy and full. Must try.
Peppers with goat cheese - perfect. Churros - perfect. Lamb ribs - perfect. Paella - great but just a bit too saucy for my liking. Potatoes - also great. Ambience - lovely with a kind staff.

name: Mamma Maria
reviews: Had an amazing dinner here! We had a reservation, but the place was packed so we still had to wait a little bit. Very cute, cozy atmosphere. We had the burrata to start, and I had the scallops with risotto for my meal. Everything had delicious flavor. Friendly, professional service. Definitely recommend for a nice dinner!
Amazing place with very friendly staff! The mushroom pasta was delicious! Cozy ambience.. perfect for a meal with friends/family!

Food is good and the restaurant is located in a nice old building. The restaurant is very crowded and we didn't reserve in advance so we were sitting at the bar counter. Rabbit stew is surprisingly good. My advice is to call in advance to reserve a proper seat for dinner. Better experience that way.

Second time at the restaurant. First time I went I was in awe of how great the customer service was. The food was amazing and I was so excited to Return. However this time around my expectations were high, as I’ve already had a great experience. Unfortunately I left disappointed. Our waiters personality was very dry, he barley spoke to us and at times I would have to physically call out to him so he would notice my drink was empty. I did feel as if he looked down at us, like we did not have enough $ to be there. After reading some of these reviews I know I wasn’t the only one who felt that. 

Although the food was great, i will not be returning because of that.

We were fortunate enough to rent out the main part of the restaurant for our rehearsal dinner. The food is SO delicious, you quite literally cannot go wrong with anything you order on the menu. You can tell the food is fresh and made to order - the meats, ravioli, salads, everything! So delectable and flavorful, unlike any other Italian dining experience I've had. The service itself was unbelievable; waitstaff were accommodating to the children who wanted to order outside of the preset menu, and were attentive to and interactive with all of our guests. Thank you so much for such an incredible evening. We will definitely be returning for another exquisite dining experience!

name: Yvonne's
reviews: First time at Yvonne's last night and I loved everything a out this restaurant. The decor, the service, the food (oh the food) and the cocktails were great. This is a unique place to go for that really special occasion that you want to create a very memorable experience. It's funky elegant atmosphere, great take on tapas style dining and historic flavor make this a place you just can't go wrong. It's now at the top of our list for Boston dining... Loved it.

What a GREAT place. One of my top 10 ever place I’ve been... Don’t get fool by the poor food pictures you see on Google...The food was Marvelous... Ask for Fiona... She was definitely part of our great experience... Next time I’m in Boston I’ll go back for sure...

The atmosphere was really amazing, it did feel like some sort of 20s speakeasy. The drinks were decent...once we got them. Our waitress forgot about us twice, when we were at a standing table right across from the bar. There were staff members constantly passing us by and none of them seemed to think it was weird the we were standing in a bar without drinks. Sure it was a little busy. But being, from what I hear, one of the most 'you gotta check this place out' bars in the area, they should be able to manage to not completely ignore patrons. I'll give it two stars, one for atmosphere and one for hope that I have a better experience when I try it again

This was a speakeasy style restaurant. The food was very good. Most dishes were sharing style. Only gave 4 stars as we waited for 15 min before waving down a server. He was very apologetic and was very attentive after. I strongly recommend this restaurant. I would suggest reservations in advance

Cute place. Love speakeasies. The cost of the beverages were bull considering they were not made strong what so ever. Have no idea about the food. It looks very good, presentation was beautiful from what I saw.

name: Barcelona Wine Bar
reviews: Went out with friends last night and we all loved our tapas! Very delicious. Someone at our table ordered a sangria pitcher and that was also very good. Camille, our waitress, was amazing. She is a sweetheart and very knowledgeable. What a wonderful night! We will definitely come back.

Great selection of wines.  Nice cocktails.  Great place for a single person because they will box up half for you to take home.  My new favorite in Boston!  Loved the 3 oz glasses of wine.  I could try two!

I like coming here because it’s really affordable for what you get. You can make reservations here which is great for when you have visitors. They’re generally good with seating you on time, except this one Saturday evening when we had to wait an hour past our reservation time to get seated. It’s so packed in there on Saturdays that it’s tricky to order a drink. But any other night, I love it.

A symphony of individuals working together and communicating effectively to ensure impeccable service, Dre and their staff went above and beyond providing us with an unforgettable experience. 

Tapas were amazing and reminded me of my mom’s home cooking and my travels to Spain. Brought back great memories. 

Ask about their unique Georgian white wine selection! Pairs eloquently with the salted cod brandada! 
Dre and their staff gave us an experience we will never forget. They set the bar real high for what good quality food and what good customer service looks like.

This place is amazing!! It’s a little high end but nothing too crazy. I LOVED the atmosphere. All the servers were super friendly. It was our first time and it blew me away. You won’t regret eating here. The portions are small so you need to get like 3-4 things per person to be full. Really enjoyed it. Also the walk around the neighborhood was pretty great too. Very nice neighborhood. Awesome ambiance all together

name: Ma Maison
reviews: Everyone's favorite French restaurant around the town. Amazing escargot, patê, duck, calf's liver, and basically everything. Service is perfect -- Waitress is very nice yet not too overbearing like some American restaurants. They know their wines -- definitely ask for recommendations on wine that pairs. Very busy everyday dinner time, make sure to reserve.

We were there last evening to celebrate our birthdays. The wonderful woman at the front helped us find a place to park (the garage on their website was full) and let me sit at our table while I waited. We began with complimentary champagne for our birthdays. I had delicious  (one of the very best) onion soup and then the duck magret. The duck was a bit underdone for me but was quickly redone. That lovely lady from the front even came over to make sure I was happy. My husband had a delicious salad and since it was a Wednesday, he was delighted with the sweetbreads.
Feeling overfed, my husband just ordered coffee. To our utter delight, a chocolate mousse arrived with a candle. We managed to devour it.
The restaurant reminded us of being in Paris. A neighborhood bistro. If only we lived in this neighborhood..

We went here to celebrate a birthday. It's a small restaurant mostly with tables for two, but also a couple of tables for big groups. Nice and elegant atmosphere. However the staff is very nice, friendly and absolutely not snobbish, especially the French guy that served us. Food was really good. We tried different dishes. Salmon, escargot, fried frogs, duck. Everything good. Only the frogs weren't crispy enough and I was expecting better
Very, very good establishment! Service was top notch, food was delicious. Parking is available down the street.. great for romantic dinners. I would highly recommend!
Slow service. Delicious food. Decent wine selection

name: Row 34
reviews: My husband and I have been eating at this restaurant for several years—less so frequently because of location, but nonetheless we make it a point to come here at least twice a year now especially in the summer. The lobster rolls are always delicious and FRESH, as is all their seafood, and you won’t find better oysters. And lastly, their customer service is second to none, I was already in love with Row 34 but they truly have a customer for life now, special thanks to Shore for wonderful customer service.

The raw bar was great! I probably ordered too much much from it. The best oysters I have had and the tuna was delicious. The clam chowder was delicious and the base was not as heavy as you get in lesser quality chowder. The lobster in the lobster roll was so fresh and delicious.
The service at the bar was very nice. 
I look forward to returning.

I ate here on the first night of my Boston trip, and it made the rest of the food I ate that week pale in comparison. I wish I remembered the name of the server because they were amazing and had great recommendations for both food and beer. We had some oysters and a lobster roll, and they were both so good. Restaurant was clean, had a great playlist going, and was well worth the wait.

2 words...Lobster tacos!!!  Lunch is here is fast...a bit pricey, but of great quality.  Robust raw bar.  Good for the casual and business crowds alike.  One of the best, and probably the most unique, clam chowder in town.  @Row34...do you finish the chowder with vermouth??

While it's not the place to go if you're looking for inexpensive dining, Row 34 offers some of the best prepared seafood in the city. They're known for their oysters, and they definitely deliver. Around a dozen oyster choices, almost all of them from Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire. All wildly fresh. The steamed mussels were delicate and the broth had a burst of citrus to it. The crab cake was light and delicate, but I do wish the portion on it was more generous. Same with the lobster roll - beautifully prepared with a hot toasted and buttered roll but would have liked a slightly larger portion. The beer list is always being updated, and it's a doozy. Deep selections from impressive breweries, and the prices are in line with what you should expect from the expensive Seaport area. Dinner for 4 came to around $320 including tip, and that was with a few rounds of drinks, plentiful oysters, and apps and split entrees.

name: The Q
reviews:
No easy parking, but don't make that a deal breaker.
Me and my party went there during the restaurant week event/ time of the year.

The crab rangoon was very good and I will recommend that as well the sea weed salad was also good.

My friends took me to the Q for my birthday dinner. It was amazing! The food was delicious and we just couldn't stop eating :) . Everything survived in a very interesting manner. I loved it. Deserts were amazing. Drinks are really good quality too.

First time having hot pot. The broth was done extremely well, tried the Mala broth. Very flavorful with a good kick to it. The beef combo was a great lunch deal and it had a great amount of beef and noodles. A big bowl of lettuce,, with a tomato, piece of broccoli and mushroom accompanied the order, which was a little odd, in my opinion. But the beef, noodles and broth were delicious.

Good food! Great experience! Hot plate idea is really cool! For people who haven't been here you can order the type of broth you would like then the sides. When the broth comes to the table it is out on a hot plate then shortly after the sides come out. You put the sides in the broth and let them cook. Different yet fun and exciting! Great service!! Even let us keep some food there while we went to a concert. Enjoy!!

This was my first spot for hot pot and it really was incredible. We have returned probably three times since. There are other hot spot places in Chinatown but this one is a bit upscale with private seating and a full bar. The broth choices are all awesome and that’s the most important component. Service has always been great  They don’t offer reservations but if you get there before 6 it’s not usually a problem - but there is a good wait by 7 pm usually.

name: Theo's Cozy Corner Restaurant
reviews: If you’re looking for a cozy corner, Theo’s is it. It’s a small local owned restaurant with good food. It doesn’t seat many people, so it gets crowded quick. It took an hour to be seated. I went with two hungry kids, so this was kind of a bummer.  I ordered the eggs Florentine and it was delicious. My husband ordered steak and eggs and the steak was a little over cooked. The staff was very friendly and catered to us. I know that kind of service is hard to find.

Very expensive but the breakfast I have ever had.  

I don't mind spending money on good food.  Portions are big, food is all fresh cooked to order.  I sat at the bar and watched the cook and he takes pride in his work.  He takes his time and does it right.

Eggs and omelettes are cooked on low temps and come out perfect.  French toast was absolutely amazing!  

Their hospitality is the best I have ever seen.  Everyone is so friendly and willing to accommodate you no matter how inconvenient it may be.

The only draw back is how small the diner is and how long you may have to wait to eat.

Although there is no bathroom I did see a few girls allowed to walk through the kitchen to go.

I would definitely go back.  It was worth the money.  Thanks for a great visit.

Best French toast I’ve had in along time. Friendly atmosphere and delicious my husband was full when we left. The owner and waitresses were friendly and attentive. We also were greeted by the owner. A MUST VISIT PLACE. Cozy is absolutely right and compliments to the cook.

You get to taste both the clam chowder and the lobster roll. Everyone kept telling me I needed to try these two meals when I visited Boston. So it was a special, and it was pretty dang good. The clam chowder had so much flavor, but the lobster roll was amazing. Spend the $25 for both, take it outside and people watch like I did.
Came here for breakfast after a night on the town. It had good food. Made very quickly. Good coffee. Very friendly staff.

name: Carmelina's
reviews: One of the best Italian food! Make sure you make reservations or call to see if they have something available. We sat at the bar which was cool because we saw both chefs spitting out amazing food!! We got the meatballs, exploding clams, a bottle of red wine, the seafood pasta and the sundays dinner. The exploding clams were the star of the night. It had a great spice and so fresh. The seafood pasta was delicious! So fresh and tasty, I ate everything. The Sunday dinner was every mans dream come true. It came with meatballs, a short rib and sausage. So good. Everything was super good. Highly recommend!

The best place for having valuable time with good friends :) Their food is always excellent. So does their service and the vibe. I definitely recommend to make a reservation before the visit! The place is quite cozy (and small).

Couldn't get reservations but got lucky as there was a cancellation and we were seated within 10 minutes.  Tuna appetizer-order it! We had the rollati and crazy Alfredo... Both were top notch!  Excellent service, great location!

A great twist on classic Italian. The menu has a lot of passion behind it and a great family feel. I had the crazy Alfredo and was very pleased with it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's difficult to get a reservation here but if you can get one it's worth the wait.

Wow let’s me be honest. Hands down best pasta I ever had in my life. I’m not a fan of pasta but this was  spectacular to the fresh bread.  I order the crazy  Alfredo that was amazing. The noodles are so soft and feel homemade not from a box that you get at the supermarket. Would recommend to anyone. I came with my friend all the way from  Connecticut  to try this place out.

name: Regina Pizzeria
reviews: Pizza was very good. Very good. Great? I can't say great. I like well done but ours was a little too well it ended up dry in certain spots. I'd obviously tell anyone I know to go because it's worth the experience. If I went again if ask for the pie to be pulled a little bit sooner from the oven. The staff was great. Really great. Awesome east coast attitude and swag with the customers all in good fun.

This is by far the best pizza I have ever had in my life and it is killing me that I don't travel there for work anymore. The crust is thin but sturdy and has the best texture- soft, chewy, fluffy, thin all at the same time somehow. I always got the pepperoni and it was so good that I am unable to properly express to you how delicious this pizza was. If you are in the area at all, you must get yourself there to enjoy some fantastic pizza.

Been going for 30+ years. My mom would take me and now I take my boy's. I've NEVER had a bad experience there no matter how long the line would be to get in. It always moves quick and it just gives us more family talk time. The pizza and staff have always been amazing. Even with covid  the pizza was delicious and staff was on point with orders, social distance and making sure the customers only touch stuff once. Pre package bag's with plates and napkins along with a pencil for signing credit card slips. You keep the pencil. No line though in and out quickly. It's a must stop by if your ever in the area

Visiting from Toronto and being an Italian-Canadian absolutely loved this place!!! Expecting this to be a high end pizza place, perfect for a date? No chance lol. This place is a dive (in the perfect sense) and probably hasn't changed since it was opened but I wouldn't change a thing. This is no frills pizza at its finest. If you are visiting Boston and you want the true Italian pizza experience, this is a must see! I would recommend the personal size pizza, which you can certainly finish if you are hungry

The wait wasn't too long. 
Pizza was very good and almost the size of the table! Yes, we had some to take home.
Service was fast and efficient. Busy, busy little place! 
Finding a parking space was extremely challenging.

name: North Street Grille
reviews: This. Is. A. Must. The hospitality is lively and unique to the neighborhood, like a reconnecting to a long lost relative. I feel like I probably had the best french toast (apple cinnamon), and the lobster omelet was beyond compare. Go. Wait for however long; best to go in the morning. It's worth the wait.

The best breakfast I have ever had.  I will most likely never go anywhere else when visiting boston for breakfast again.  Espresso martini, fluffy pancakes, eggs Benedict to order.  And grandmas secret banana bread recipe is better than ... well let’s just say that I want to go back tomorrow!
Good was delicious. Service fantastic. Place was jammed, but they got us in and served quickly. Great stop.

We had a fantastic experience here. Great service from the hostess, who kept checking in on us throughout. Exceptional service from the waitstaff and kitchen. We have two kids with food allergies and they were extremely vigilant about making sure everything was safe and there was no risk of cross contamination. You don't find that often in places with small kitchens that have a great business. The food was fantastic as well. Overall, highly recommend.

Incredible food.  This restaurant came recommended from our hotel front desk and it did not disappoint.  It's a small place across from Paul Reveres house so it took a few minutes to get a seat at the breakfast bar.  We had some mimosas to start and got the crab cakes Benedict and the fried chicken and waffles sliders.  The service was excellent and the food was even better.  I wish the waffle would have been a touch more crispy on the sliders, but other than that, it was superb.

name: Galleria Umberto
reviews: Always excellent, fresh food.  The pizza is the best I've ever had. Just can't duplicate that taste. My other favorite is the panzerotti, melts in your mouth. However, everything else is just as delectable!

Pizza is delicious, employees are always kind, & patient, relaxed atmosphere, love it here just reminds me of growing up Italian, tables & chairs, street parking, was very clean, smells amazing, reasonably priced & portions are filling. The pizza & calzones were so hot it steamed the windows in the car on the way home. If ur ever in the area or craving Italian food definitely check it out. If any1 was used in a photo without permission let me know I'll take it down. Go show them some love.

Consistent high quality authentic Italian slices and Arancini. Can be very busy on weekends, so recommend getting there early in the day, as they can sell out! You order at the counter, but plenty of seating to sit and enjoy your meal. Family run, with great service. In my opinion this is the best pizza outside of Italy, and always worth the wait!

This is not only the best deal in the US for a slice of pizza ($1.90), but it's also possibly the best pizza you could even try. Don't get hung up on only having "cheese" to choose from with no toppings. You don't need more than that here. Superb.
The pizza was tasty. I was a fan of the sauce. The arancini were also very authentic and delicious.

name: Mario's Restaurant
reviews: Authentic home cooked Italian food, small and quaint and an excellent vibe.  Staff is family and the service was excellent as was the food.
Family atmosphere. Super friendly staff. Great food.

I celebrated my PhD this evening in this delicious restaurant. Well we passed a outstanding evening and the place was absolutely the reason for that happy gathering. The team  cooperated in a gorgeous manner, the food was tasty and my guests were extremely  cheerful. We shall absolutely come back again for more events. Thank you very much.

We needed a place for a quick dinner close to the airport, reasonably priced and easy to get back on the highway. This fit the bill perfectly. We started with excellent bread to pair with your choice of butter or Olive oil. Then our meals all included salad which was perfect portion.  My pollo Alla Lisa was excellent. Everyone enjoyed their food. Cozy place. Will go back if we need to go to Logan.

It's all available for here or to go. While I was waiting to place and order, a fresh pizza came out of the oven and went on display behind the glass. I changed for that. It was still super hot! Sliced gyro meat, lumps of ricotta cheese and pesto, it was delicious and filling. One slice was enough.

name: Rino's Place
reviews: This place is soooooo good!! Italian food just like in the North End. The lobster ravioli is the best we’ve had in Boston (and we have had a lot of different places’ lobster ravioli!). Generally a line to get in so plan accordingly...or get take out! YUM!!!!

Amazing Italian. Definitely my top favorite Italian restaurant in Boston. It's quite difficult to get a table on Saturdays but it is certainly worth the wait. Super friendly staff. Nice hospitality. Menu is not super huge but everything sounds and tastes delicious. Their handmade pasta is wonderful and is highly recommended. Ordering food food take it is also a good option. Generous portion. Parking is very difficult with lots of resident parking.

Very friendly staff and server gave great recommendation as this was our first time visiting. But won't be our last. There are a ton of good options for meat and seafood lovers. Most pastas are homemade. Very cute place that's not too big but they can accompany large parties. Good spot to catch up with friends or bring a first date.
Tip: they do half portions/orders for appetizers, so if there are only 2 of you and you plan to try more than 1 appetizer and plan to each get an entree then you may want to opt for half sizes. The calamari pictured is a half size

A hidden gem recommended by local. Cute and cozy. Like a ma and pa restaurant in fine cuisine level. Only had their lobster ravioli which was so remarkable that we went back for the second time for it! Note: rather than dining in this time, we ordered it to go and eat at the park down the street because of the corona crisis

A lot of people recommended places in the north end. While I’m sure those places are good, Rino’s was amazing! Huge portions at a great price! Can’t recommend this place enough. Not on the beaten path, but well worth the short trip to east Boston!

name: Dino's Cafe
reviews: Good customer service from Mr. Dino. Very friendly and welcoming. My oven baked chicken fettuccine was great!! And my husband had a steak n cheese sub which he loved. Excellent food and can't wait to go back there again.

I take my family to this great restaurant  a lot! This is the best place to dine.  I visit this spot routinely. The food is fantastic, the workers are friendly and the prices are good. I enjoy meeting in this spot to have a rich supper.

Reasonable price especially for North End, great value and super quick service. We came in as a party of 7, and in 7 minutes we were already eating. Rare occasion but a definite 5 out of 5. Just look at the size of that thing

Great little sub and sandwich shop in Boston. Made with fresh ingredients by hand right in front of you, the quality and taste is incredible. Prices or decent as well, $12 for a foot long that is definitely more than 12".

Came for dinner for my friend's birthday. We had a great time and our server Emer was fantastic and delightful! We were sat next to a couple who complained that their food took too long to arrive even though it came at a perfectly standard time. I believe their complaints were completely uncalled for because everything here is done so well and was done perfectly that night.

name: Italian Express Pizzeria
address: 336 Sumner St, East Boston, MA 02128, USA
reviews: the champagne comes out in an extravagant champagne cooler with ice, plus you get a cute little tray with peach, grapefruit, and orange juice. My only comment there is that they could provide more juice. The breakfast skillet was delicious. Fluffy eggs? Check. Irresistibly crunchy potatoes and bacon? Also check.
Best Calamari I've ever had! The ricotta in the eggplant rolls was spot on and the ravioli & homemade meatballs OMG! Service was great and a nice clean atmosphere.

Awesome pizza shop. We order a 4 slices of pizza for 2 people.  Let me just say, 1 each is enough.  The portions are HUGE.  With that being said, everything is delicious.  The guys working are very friendly.  Lots of locals stop by all the time.  I highly recorded this place if you are in the area.

The wife and I Love visiting different food establishments, came across this one on the food network about 6 months ago ... On our next trip to Boston we HAD to go ... and boy are we glad we did ... Food was amazing in taste with massive portions ... reasonable prices  nice atmosphere and even met the owner Jim. who took time to sit down by us to ask how everything was ... Will make it a must stop every trip into Boston
I loved the pizza. Aside from getting great service, I got a delicious free pasta. I would definitely go back to this new spot.

name: Arya Trattoria
reviews:
Amazing!!!! The service was fantastic and the food was absolutely delicious! Homemade pasta and super fresh seafood. They even split a plate for us making one spicy and the other not. Perfect meal.

Update: we returned! More delicious food 🤤

This small restaurant is very charming. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. It can get loud. The meatballs are really some of the best I’ve had. Wine selection was good. The pasta was good, not my favorite but still good.

Picked up a 1/2 platter of the sausage and broccoli cavatelli. It was slightly cheesy but not too garlicky. Would’ve wanted larger pieces of broccoli though. The sausage was similar to broken up pieces of meatballs. Nice sear. The meatballs were amazing ($18 for 4). Tender with a wonderful herby flavor. The tomato sauce punches through the salt.
Amazing food and wine!  The best thing about this is that the people that work there make visitors from out of town feel like regulars. Practically like family that has been eating there for years.
Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Wonderful service! Exceptional food! Cozy and comfortable atmosphere! Lovely!  But pricey, but oh, so worth it!

name: Fox & The Knife
reviews:
Fabulous food, really. Just so savory, multi layered and interesting. Amazing service (we ate at the bar). Superb presentation.
I don't know that anything could be improved upon.
My food allergies were definitely paid attention to, which I am ALWAYS thankful for!

Takeout during quarantine, so maybe that affected their food. It’s a limited menu so they’re probably cooking in bulk. All of it was pretty bland. When you consider the cost, there’s no chance I’d give them a second chance. 

Presumably the food is better in person based on these other reviews. Also worth noting the extremely small portions (not a problem this time, since I didn’t want to eat what I received).

After weeks of waiting, we were finally able to secure a coveted reservation at Fox & The Knife! We were very well versed in the acclaim they were getting, and were excited to see what the fuss was about. 

We were seated promptly and were greeted by a very informative waitress. She knew the answer to all of our questions and we were really impressed by her. The meal only got better from here, they have an extensive wine and cocktail list, which added a great component to our meal. The pasta was extremely fresh and very fun to share with others in our party. All of the dishes were great and tasted extremely fresh. The meal did not disappoint, and we are already looking forward to our next visit.

Some of the best pasta we've had so far. The foccacia is to DIE for: perfectly cheesy and warm and light. They have a wide vegetarian selection as well which is great. The staff are super friendly and attentive as well. Cannot wait to go back already!
What can I say that hasn't been said before? We came in and had an amazing experience start to finish. Great food, great drinks, great staff - really an absolute gem of a restaurant

name: Bar Mezzana
reviews: Service was wonderful and cocktails and wine list amazing!! Unfortunately the pasta was just ok. It was very under seasoned, had to add salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes & I don’t like salty food. I got the black truffle fettuccine and the black truffle did not have any flavor at all. Could have just been any old mushroom shaved on top. A bit disappointed for the price and expectation.

I have been to Bar Mezzana many times and I am always impressed by their cuisine and staff. Their restaurant is state of the art and is located in the Ink Block on Harrison Avenue. I have too many favorites to list.

One of the best meals I’ve had all year, I would HIGHLY recommend their tasting menu (called something like family menu). Excellent service, high quality food and well thought out dishes. Couldn’t ask for a better dinner in Boston! Would definitely come back.

DELICIOUS! Stopped in for a quick dinner on the patio and appreciated the quick, attentive service. Their wine list is almost all Italian but a very unique selection that I enjoyed. For starters, I got the beef tartare and it was phenomenal. I could have eaten just that because the portion was so generous! I got pasta for my main and was only able to eat half but loved every single bite. Highly recommend this spot for a casual but delicious night out!!
Really nice ambiance.. I like the vibe and the food. Definitely a place that I want to go back to

name: La Summa
reviews: High quality Italian food in a charming setting. Jazzy music, warm romantic vibe - would be a nice place for a date. The menu is not too expensive, so I came here with a group of 7 work friends and we all left happy, even with wine, appetizers and dessert. The food was delicious with lots of options.

This place is one of the best hidden gems of the North end! The staff was so friendly, the wine amazing, and the homemade pasta was out of this world! It's a perfect atmosphere for a nice family dinner, important date, or just trying to enjoy some authentic Italian food! I can't wait till my next visit.
The food is phenomenal. Everything we order was great. My only issue is parking. Would definitely go back.

Great find. Like having dinner with an old friend and this was our first time there. Barbara came over to our table make sure everything was to our liking. It was even better than that. One of the best values in town. Wonderful experience,  great restaurant and great food.

The staff here moves as fast as they can but the one thing if there was any to complain about is the slow service with the cocktails. Not sure if it was because these were some serious creative cocktails or what but the time from one to the next was long, almost too long. Dessert was forgetful and needed work, could do without the Greek donuts and chocolate Twinkie

name: Cafe Polonia
reviews: Very small but quaint. Reservations are a must. Staff were very friendly and service was good. Food was really good too. We started with Salmon and Caviar which was to die for. Our dinners were great. The kielbasa was my favorite. My husband loved it all! Sadly, we were too full for dessert.

Food is amazing. It was just like a home cooked meal someone spent all day cooking. 

Service was polite. Restaurant is very small. The neighborhood was not very nice however. They would attract more customers being in a better spot in the city.

We went with some friends and had a great time! Reservations are a must as it is a small restaurant. The servers are friendly but do fall behind a bit on drink refills sometimes, still nothing major and we will definitely come again sometime.

Love, love love, this little shop. I'm from NJ where our Polish food is Legendary, however i saw this place on Diners Drive-In's and Dives so I thought I'd check it out. If you love Polish "soul food" then make sure you stop by and tell them Martha from NJ sent you!

Cafe Polonia offers a truly authentic atmosphere, with nice wooden tables and much traditional decor. As a central European, I was surprised how much it reminded me of home. The Polish beer and food tasted great, and the warm chocolate cake was a pure delight. They even got the whipped cream right!

name: Boston Sail Loft
reviews: Went on a weeknight when I was in town on business.  Best chowder I’ve had in Boston, others feel the same way. Bowl serving size is good for a whole meal, and it’s a large cup! The atmosphere had character, as did Steve (I think) who was the bartender, who provided great service, and you could tell this was a family owned restaurant - welcoming, hospitable, and professional.  Great company as well in there, nice vibe, right on the water.  It’s a great place all around.  The size of the restaurant is probably not perfect for huge groups without calling ahead, but I think great for the restaurant itself because it is conducive to conversation with others.  Try them out!

Amazing food and friendly staff.  I've been here several times over the years and it's never disappointed.  The seafood is very fresh and the quality is great.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had; so much so that I get it every time I come.  Other good dishes are the scrod (so fresh) and the various stir frys.  You also can't pass up the homemade onion rings.  Prices are about average for the area.  I highly recommend it!
Tried seafood for the first and was pleased with the food. Had the lobster Mac n cheese, fish and chips and calm chowder. Very rich but very creamy and filling.

This site is my number one restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to this restaurant. everytime  I I need a good lunch, this restaurant comes instantly to my mind. excellent and all kinds of  food and a large list of dishes.well mannered staff, and agreeable spirit. Also, the bill is affordable. I tell about this place with pleasure.

One of the best chowders I’ve ever had! Place was packed solid when we got there but always a good sign for fresh food. Great quality overall but found the prices comparative to the area which all seemed inflated due to the high tourism. Service was really friendly and seemed very organized especially with the volume of guests coming in. As I said one of the best chowders with this incredible fresh dill that played well off the other ingredients. Certainly worth a visit.

name: Scampo
reviews:
Really terrific food served by a wait staff that was so professional and warm they felt like family. Only, super minor gripe, is that the restaurant seems more casual online than it really is. The prices were modest and the food superb, but I was expecting a more casual environment and instead was in a very upscale restaurant. Not that anyone made us feel out of place. It was a wonderful experience.

Also, the history of the restaurant, being an old jail house, was extraordinary!! Really unique experience for my family I can't wait to repeat!!

Dine Out Boston lunch. Lemon sole did not disappoint. Beautiful plating and nice contrast in flavors made it a pleasure to devour. Tiramisu was just okay. I like more moisture in the sponge from the espresso. Beautiful space with a colorful past. Too bad no dinner menu for Dine out, but will have to try anyway.
Great spot for a classy date night, celebration, or girls night out. Delicious food at reasonable portion sizes and great service. Creative menu with classics as well to hit all moods.

Great jailhouse setting and stylish decor, varied menu with a bit of a seafood focus. Pizza and spaghetti dominate their specialty items, although you can find other cultural nods to Indian and other cuisines.

Service was terrific, food was average, price was to high for what you get. I have eaten at many similarly priced restaurants and would happily go to others before returning. Mind you I only had select dishes but these were ones recommend for the wait staff. As noted the service is great here.

name: Union Oyster House
reviews: The Union Oyster House is the oldest continually-operating restaurant and oyster bar in the United States. This coupled with its convenient central location was enough to convince me of visiting. The food was great with generous portions. The range of seafood options on the menu was also great. Perfect as a treat and open till late, which is a bonus. This historical landmark also has its own gift shop where you purchase merchandise imprinted with the Union Oyster House logo.

We were visiting Boston from Toronto and this was our first restaurant stop. With the rave reviews we were not disappointed! First off, oldest restaurant in Boston, just adds to the overall experience here. Walking into the place is like stepping back in time. Second, our server here was excellent. He was knowledgeable on the menu and provided his recommendations based on our preferences. We ended going for the clam chowder, lobster, and steamers.
