With the clam chowder being our first experience in Boston, we were certainly not disappointed. It was creamy, thick and had ample potatoes and clams!! It is a must try at the Union Oyster House. Fun fact that the server shared with us; on your way out of the restaurant you can check in at the main desk (beside the gift shop) and requests the recipes for both the clam chowder and the cornbread! Nice little added bonus to top-off your visit here

This place was very good! Visited for Restaurant Week. Started with Fried Calamari, excellent. Entree, I went with lightly fried oysters which came with french fries... Yummy! Finished it off with apple cobbler.  Good stuff.  Worth coming back. Next time I would like to sit at the oyster bar.

This place was great!  Our service both times we came was superb.  I can’t figure out which was my favorite, the Boston key lime pie or the chowder.  Who am I kidding, I loved both!  This place was recommended to us and it lived up to the hype.  Highly recommend!

Recently dined at the UOH. We ordered the clam chowder... which was very good. Followed by the fried seafood platter, broiled seafood platter and baked beans. I think the beans were the best part of the meal. The rest was quite bland. I was expecting more. Our server was awesome, though, and the space is quite steeped in history. Glad we went but would not return. Also, the bathrooms are impossibly small.

name: MIDA
reviews: Great place to have dinner with friends or a date night. Everything I had was yummy! The polenta, garlic butter bread, lobster scampi entre, mussels, salad and citrus cake (pound cake). Love the decor.  I will definitely be back!

First come first served at the bar. We were able to find seats at the upstairs bar right away. The waitstaff was super quick and personable. Drinks were fast. Food was all super tasty and arrived quickly. Pancakes were very fluffy and the frittata was huge.  Live music downstairs was fun, though it you wanted a quieter space you should go upstairs.

Wow was this good. Starting with the antipasto, then chicken, gnocchi, scallops, and spaghetti with crab. All dishes were excellent. Flavors were well balanced. Service was friendly and efficient. One of the best dinners it we've had in a long time. Oh and the alcohol free drinks were fabulous.
This place is consistently great. Very good food. Very tasty! Great music selection. The wait staff was amazing. I'd definitely recommend.

this place has it all. ridiculous food. solid cocktails. great staff. intimate neighborhood  feel. chef should be in james beard conversations right now. go before you can't get in the door for the line.

name: Asta
reviews: The place is very nice and the service exquisite. Every dish was nicely presented. For me it wasn't a 5 star because everything was really good but none of the dishes blew my mind. The menu changes often so I'm sure they have amazing dishes. Out of everything we had the scallops with capers was probably my favorite.

Pretty awesome dining experience, but like a lot of others have said we were served a lot of root vegetables, which bothers me from a value perspective. We got the 5 dish tasting and dishes were delicious and wine pairings were great! We got the foie Gras add on and split one order for two, which was plenty. Food was plentiful too! 

I would consider visiting again to try a different menu, the server mentioned the menu rotates about every 6 weeks so maybe in the spring we'll try again.
Great restaurant with wonderful people. Fun, energetic, and casual yet serving creative, delicious food in a tasting menu format.

We come infrequently but are always impressed with the improvement and experimentation. The asta team delights us, sometimes surprises us, and always makes us happy. Unlike most places with tasting menus, they allow and elegantly handle if people in the party want to have different sets.
Very friendly.  Vegetable focused tasting menu place.  Called a hidden gem by one of the locals

name: Grotto
reviews: I come to this excellent place many times because I like the special air that is characterizes this place. The team is highly cordial and experienced. The service is pretty fast. Most important, the food you get is perfect. I have been there more than once and I was never disappointed. The expense is decent. I recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.
Their food was absolutely excellent! The portions were perfect. The service was great. The lunch prices are reasonable. Will definitely be stopping by again!

This restaurant is mine and my boyfriend's favorite restaurant in Boston! It is incredibly romantic and one of our first dates. The food is some of the best Italian food I have ever had! I recommend The Grotto to everyone I can.

Dinner was pretty fantastic.  Nice space, dimly lit (in a good way).  Servers were friendly and attentive....just right.  The duck confit was excellent.  Slightly crispy skin, moist, nice portion.  They accommodated me by switching from a bed of brussel  sprouts to wild mushroom.  (Definitely better...seriously.)  The butter poached lobster linguine with a tomato sauce was also very good.  Nice chunks of lobster, didn't skimp.  Ended with the molten chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream.

Go.  Follow my lead.  I think you'll be happy.
The best kept secret! All their food is amazing. The staff is fun and friendly. So great and quaint. Wonderful spot!

name: Deuxave
reviews:
Artfully presented in a soothing atmosphere accented by exceptional service.

Is there room for improvement? Always. Particularly in regard to the potatoes in the steak dish. Having them in the same cut but double fried in duck fat would elevate the dish.

Nice fine dining restaurant in the Back Bay. I had the tasting and enjoyed most of my entrees immensely, with a couple of standouts (the Crispy Duck Confit and the Pan Seared Atlantic Halibut). Nice wine pairings. Felt like I got a meal commensurate with the price tag.
The food and ambiance was outstanding. We were there for my husband's birthday. I requested for a customized  table with few surprise elements and they were on point with what I asked for.
Upmarket dining with very well executed dishes. Delicious. 4.5 stars.

Excellent service. Celebrated our one year anniversary  here and will come back again. Exquisite cuisine, intimate environment and warm staff that made us feel special.  Highly recommend for fancy dining.

name: No.9 Park
address: 9 Park St Pl, Boston, MA 02108, USA
reviews: Superb ambience and super personal service. The menu was crisp and enchanting. Will absolutely recommend this spot to friends and family. Convenient prices and generous portions. Great work.
Flawless service in a relaxed atmosphere...no attitude here. The food was equally flawless in execution, and a relatively good value. I would definitely return, especially to just drop in at the bar.
We had a fabulous time here. The food is delicious and plentiful, we had a variety on our table. Staff are incredibly helpful and can't do enough for you. As we had a slight.
Very neat and convenient spot. They provide big meals and for affordable prices. We loved the menu a lot and the staff were very affable and informative. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.

I eat in this lovely spot  a lot! This is my favorite place to to have a good dinner.  I go to this spot frequently. The cooking is just great, the staff members are polite and the price is decent. I like eating in this restaurant over a rich lunch.

name: Chickadee
reviews: Food and drinks were good and had creative use of interesting ingredients.  But while generally good, every dish we ordered was just a little off in its own way to keep this restaurant from ascending to the peer group in which it hopes to be mentioned.  I am hopeful with a little refinement, they can make the necessary changes to menu and/or preparation that will improve things because it has the potential.

Quick, friendly service, great atmosphere, great drinks. Food, amazing. Absolutely delicious, will go back very soon. We had the Duck with duck sausages, it was perfectly cooked and paired amazingly with the salad. The rabbit pasta was delicious and balanced to a "T". The almond cake was delicious and light with the silky ricotta sorbet. Go to this restaurant.
Went for brunch and had an amazing experience. From the service, to the banana bread, and the amazing pancakes. A truly great meal. Highly recommended.

Really blown away by this place
Would def like to come back 
Good service and also able to facilitate a dairy restriction 

Please note that due to the dairy restriction they deconstructed some dishes and they might look different from how they are normally served

Such a lovely evening at Chickadee over the holidays. We were blown away by the Hen of the Woods and roasted carrots dishes. There's a lot to be said about restaurant that can brag about it's small plates. The interior is modern, but cozy, and the service was an example of true hospitality.

name: Grill 23 & Bar
reviews:
Omg!!!
I had an amazing experience at grill 23. The staff is very friendly and well informed on the product they are offering. The steak was cooked to perfection and very rich with flavors. The lobster tails were succulent. The fried calamari wasn't the greatest, it was a bit to dry for me. Excellent wine collection....I will definitely go back

A crown jewel among all restaurants we’ve been so far. Well worth every penny we spent. Definitely recommend their steaks and sides (esp Brussels sprouts and mushrooms). Loved their attention to detail and their attentive service. Be back again for another special occasion 👍🏼

Came here as part of a large group from a conference I was attending. The restaurant itself was just amazing. The food was top notch. The steak that I ordered was cooked to perfection. Everything about the meal was fantastic. The staff never missed a beat and was on top of everyone in the large group, making sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommend this spot when visiting Boston!

I love this place! It's upscale, but it doesn't feel stuffy. The food is top notch, and the portion sizes are HUGE! An excellent restaurant for any special occasion. Pro Tip: I know this restaurant doesn't seem like the kind of place to get tater tots, but Grill 23's are incredible.

Oh my God! This restaurant is so nice... That for someone like me (from Portugal) I could only see it in movies... And finally being in it... It's mind blowing. I totally recommend it to anyone that is in Boston. Best restaurant ever!

name: Neptune Oyster
reviews: Got in line at around 11:15am on a Friday morning. There were a few people a head of us. We were allowed in at about 11:35. Since it’s not too big of a restaurant and was only 2 of us, we shared a table with 2 others. Servers were great, explained all of our options and the food was fantastic! We ordered the crab bisque, which was amazing, along with the hot lobster roll and a few oysters. The food was fresh, tasty and was served pretty quickly. Definitely get there early in order to be seated first.

Very cozy oyster bar. Oysters were fresh and good quality- a lot to choose from too. I love the lobster roll but you can probably find equally good ones elsewhere for cheaper. The other dishes we tried, primarily seafood, were also delicious. Be prepared for the queue though especially in winter- there is limited room for waiting inside...

All of the food is delicious. And the atmosphere is my favorite - cozy, great lighting, lively but not too loud. I went alone and was seated immediately at the bar... Twice, which was great. Prepare to wait if you come with 2+ people though.

Simply the best Oysters I’ve eaten anywhere! In addition, their other dishes are great too, especially the lobster rolls. 

Love the atmosphere, service is great and it’s always buzzing inside. I like that it’s small inside but just means you have to arrive early otherwise be prepared to wait. 

Always at the top of my list when visiting Boston - highly recommended!

If you want oysters, this is the only spot you should go in Boston. But be ready for a long wait, as this place is always popular. Even for lunch for one on a weekday, expect an hour wait. On the weekends, a table for two can take several hours — there are many great bars and sights to see in the area so the wait goes by quickly. The hostess that usually takes names is a no nonsense woman, she’s cold and has to deal with tourists and those who aren’t willing to deal with the long lines. Don’t take it personally! 

Once inside, you’ll be able to enjoy the cozy atmosphere and see all of the fresh seafood Neptune has to offer. Enjoy the wide selection of oysters and fresh pastas, it’s well worth your time.

name: RUKA
reviews: Cocktails have been amazing with a fine selection of rare additions. Really well curated experience. Sushi sounds super healthy and quinoa based, but amazingly buttery salmon and quality tuna. Definitely worth a few stops to see the offerings. A little on the pricey side, so save a few dollars and save this place for a special date.

We went for our honeymoon and the food was spectacular! The oysters were out of this world as was the chicken fried rice. Great portions for tapas. Ryan was our server and he was absolutely amazing. Our water was refilled the second it got low and he was the quickest waiter I’ve ever experienced. If you go, I would recommend to ask for a table with him. Best waiter in Boston!

Great cocktails - LOVED the snap pea one. Matcha one was good too. Really cool interior design w lots of carved stone, metal and woke accents, and sick murals on the walls. Food was amazeballs - sushi on point. Noodles? Crazy. Would be great for a date night or to bring a fancy colleague. Get it.

If you want a culinary adventure go to Ruka.  Small plates so you can sample everything
The wait staff is friendly and well versed in the menu and happily explain everything.  Drinks are large and excellent.  The atmosphere is more than cool.  Best calamari I have ever had.  The octopus my favorite.  Try it, you will love it.

This was a great surprise! We loved it. It you have kids make sure to get the calamari. The pink pieces (picture included) move. Very freaky and our 10 year old loved it. 
Some of the best sushi I’ve ever had.

name: Bistro du Midi
reviews: The black truffle cauliflower soup was lovely, it was flavorful with a nice texture.  The Hake had  perfectly crisp skin, was cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful.  The Frangipane tasted wonderful.  The mango ice cream was the best ice cream, smooth texture and nice mango flavor.  The meal was lovely.  Our waiter Richard, was knowledgeable, helpful and friendly, he explained every dish clearly, with the appropriate amount of detail.
My friend and I sat upstairs for a late lunch and it was quiet and lovely. Staff was polite and attentive. I can't wait to come back for dinner. I highly recommend.

Friendly waitstaff, ambiance nice but not stuffy, and delicious food -- Bistro du Midi was great! The chicken main dish and the side of mushrooms with anchovies were amazing, and the chocolate souffle to die for! We loved having dinner here.

The second time I have gone there for a tasting  and I can't recommend it enough! Every dish is better than the last. One of Boston's finest restaurants. The staff, service and ambiance were exceptional.

I celebrated my graduation this evening in this great place. I am glad to say that it was a great evening and the restaurant was definitely the reason for that outstanding meeting. The crew  collaborated in a graceful way, the cooking was yummy and my buddies were very  glad. We shall absolutely come back again for more events. thanks very much.

name: Eastern Standard
reviews: A friend and I stopped in Before the Before the Celts game.  It was International women's day and they had drinks for that which was nice. Drinks were exquisite. Bartender was very pleasant

Everything was perfect about this experience. The staff were beyond accommodating and the ambience was impeccable. Neurobiology could probably explain the bonding chemicals I felt eating this food. If you want to fall in love, eat here.

The place is huge, tons of seating (including the bar area). The service was very quick. We received our drinks within in minutes and the meal shortly after. We both ordered the scrambled eggs plate ($13) - one with bacon the other with sausage. The potatoes were well seasoned and very filling. The plate comes with 3 eggs, which is nice since most places serve just 2. The sausage was two links but the bacon was only two thin strips- so I feel like that was kind of skimpy. Other than that, no complaints! Overall the food and drinks were fairly priced, service was quick, everyone was friendly and the food was delicious with large portions. Great brunch spot!

The food is very good, although the prices a little high. A beer costs between 8 and 14 dollars. A hamburger costs about 15 dollars. The waitress (I think she was Colombian) gave us excellent service. The place is highly recommended if you want to spend about 30-40 dollars per guest. The building is historic and also looks very beautiful.

It was very easy to find and there was service right as we stepped in. After we ordered the food came in about 10-20 minutes and the food was amazing! Barring a piece of string in our lobster roll the food was super good. We went for brunch  and they had good sandwiches and potatoes. The best were the mussels with super good flavor.

name: The Oceanaire Seafood Room
reviews: Had the best time celebrating my boyfriend birthday.... they had custom menus waiting for us....been craving the lobster mac &cheese since I left and my rib eye steak had so much flavor...so much to choose from on the drink menu....the manager Lucas is so genuine sweet and caring... can't wait to go back
Very delicious food, great atmosphere and an amazing experience in all. I definitely recommend the scallops and my sister got the halibut. Without a doubt the best food I had in years.

Okay, this is going to be lengthy, but here goes. We had our wedding reception here about a week ago and I truly cannot say enough good things about the staff at The Oceanaire, namely the event coordinator, Bailey, with whom we worked very closely with over the last year of planning our big day. 

My now husband and I searched tirelessly for months for a wedding venue, but could not find anything in the downtown Boston area that was affordable for two twenty-somethings who were going to be footing the majority of the bill. The Oceanaire had been our go to dinner spot for NYE for the past several years and became a tradition; while sitting at the bar on NYE 2018, talking about plans to elope, I thought "I wonder if this place does weddings..." The bartender gave me Bailey's business card, so I sent an email the next day; she responded almost immediately, with several attachments for dining options, bar menus, etc. which, to my surprise, were more affordable than ALL of the downtown Boston hotel quotes I had gotten. We both are huge foodies, so we were immediately hooked on the idea of a downtown winter wedding, complete with an exquisite dining experience in a gorgeous, historical building.

Over the course of the year, we came here every few months for tastings, drink selections, timeline meetings, etc. and Bailey was always there, punctual with our file in hand and a waiter ready to take our order. Our email thread is probably over 200 messages long, mostly of me changing my mind about certain things - I don't think I ever waited more than 48 hours for a response from her on anything. No matter what it was, Bailey accommodated us on EVERYTHING, even if it meant having to do things herself. She made our table cards and menus, organized the candles/centerpiece set up, set up the props for our photobooth, contacted all of our vendors to create a day of timeline...I mean, I quite literally could NOT have done this without her, as I did not have a wedding planner or day-of coordinator.

The day before the wedding, I had so much anxiety over the small things that people don't even notice, naturally. My husband just kept saying, "Bailey is really good, she has got it. There is nothing to worry about." He was so right. When we got to our reception, I almost burst into tears with how perfect everything looked, better than I had even imagined in my own, non-creative head. She stayed the entire night, checking in with us to ensure everything ran smoothly and on schedule, as best as possible. 

Several of our guests said that this was the best wedding they had ever been to; I was so surprised and flattered, but how could I be when Bailey was behind it all? From the AMAZING raw bar and passed apps to the mouth watering entrees, many guests also said this was the first time they weren't starving at the end of the night at a reception! People were raving about the food, which is the one thing we cared about...GOOD FOOD. Boy did the Oceanaire deliver! One quote from my great-uncle: "This was the best key lime pie I'd had in decades." The service from the waitstaff and overall flow of the evening was just perfect; everyone had an outstanding experience, especially my husband and me.

OKAY. So, to summarize, we quite literally could not recommend this place more to have a wedding. It was so stress free and easy! Bailey, is one of the best in the business, and you would be lucky to have her coordinate your wedding or big dinner gala. The food was AMAZING and the service was second to none. Thank you so much, Bailey, and The Oceanaire Seafood Room for making our wedding day so incredibly perfect. We will definitely be returning every year for our anniversary!

The food has always been outstanding. The service was so accommodating for our sweet 16 dinner, I would not have wanted to have dined at any other restaurant. From the door, the hostess was helpful and warm, as was our waiter (I can't recall their names). They asked all the right questions/volunteered info when it came to the details of how the night could/should go. This was a 1st for me. To top the night off in the WORST way ever, I had issues with my bank (paying 4 a # of birthday things, they put a fraud alert hold). The manager, Lucas, was BEYOND understanding which allowed me to focus on hosting vs having a panic attack! In the end, the bank remedied...I could host...guest laughed and the birthday girl has a memory worth having. Thank you Oceanaire and staff! 😍😍😍 I highly recommend!

Outstanding overall experience! Beautiful ambiance,  exceptional food made to perfection, and superior service. Occasion: Date night on New Year's Eve. We ordered filet mignon with mashed potatoes and rack of lamb. Convenient valet parking as well.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
reviews: Had dinner with a group of friends for a birthday dinner. Large selection of meat, a buffet type space where you choose your own entrees. Great cocktails and drinks. Like the idea of the servers bringing you fresh cooked meat at your table whenever you request it. Innovative and efficient. However dinner was pricey. It's great for people with good appetite

Best Brazilian steakhouse ever! This place is amazing. You will leave full and satisfied. The meats are supreme cuts and cooked to perfection. Well worth the money. Forgot to take pics I was so focused on eating. I'll be back here soon. Photos to come

Last week, I took a group of ten coworkers here for dinner. Drinks were delicious and the food didn't stop coming. While I didn't personally try the sausage, many said it was fantastic. I tried everything else and really enjoyed it. The waitstaff was able to get us in and the place was clean.

The entrance could be a bit clearer, as we entered a shopping mall with broken escalators first, only to go back down and find the correct entrance.

What an AMAZING culinary experience!
Very energetic top notch BEAUTIFUL restaurant. You can find here your favorite meats, rich salad bar, and a very yummy salmon! 
I LOVED my complimentary birthday cake!
THANK YOU Fogo de Chão for an amazing night! 💕

Vegans beware! This wholesome, all-you-can-eat meat eatery is the best around. Pay for a significant other, but any other type of other and you're definitely splitting the check. Let yourself starve before you come here, I do every time and never regret it. It may take 45 minutes after you're full before someone asks if you want to pay. Do not worry, you will have plenty of time to talk with your table about how good the food was; this is Portuguese custom (I think).

name: Venezia Restaurant Boston
reviews: This place has great burgers. The service was awesome and nice. The whole table enjoyed there food. Great place to hang out.Had lunch here yesterday and the food was excellent. I got the Scallop roll with fries special and it was the best! Large plump scallops on a large roll. Fries were tasty. Good portions and great beer selection on draft.

I went to an elegant, beautiful wedding there in October. Big function hall with all differ rooms and places to congregate . Like front room when you walk in had bar along with imported aged cheeses and crackers before heading to main function hall to eat. Off hall is an oversized patio with seating overlooking water . They even have second floor with bridal room and for photography before wedding party is introduced to the guests. Thorough, dressed up staff to go along with sofisticated interior. Easily enough room for the over 200 guests . What a memory for Bride . Fit enough for a princess ! Food was AMAZING

Very romantic restaurant.  Delicious food and service second to none.  We made a late afternoon reservation so we could enjoy the beautiful view of the river and downtown Boston before and as the sun set.  I highly recommend this place.  We plan on going back again.
Nice dining room. Excellent service and the food was outstanding. Girls night out and we had a wonderful time at Venezia and we will be back.

Although I didn't cater this event (so I can't rate them from that perspective) we had a very nice experience here. Food was great, service was great. We ate on the restaurant side, they also have a banquet hall. We had about 30 people at a busy time on a Saturday and the service, while a little slow at times, was still as prompt as you could expect. We'll be back.

name: Committee
reviews:
This place is awesome! Everything was so so so good. Had to make ourselves leave to not order everything. 

Amazing date spot and the drinks were next level.

Could come here every week!

Classy place that kind of has the vibe of a club but also the type of place you take your parents when they’re visiting town—at least that’s what we did, haha. The lights are low. Candles are lit. Music is bumping. We were fans!

Service is great. Food is amazing. It’s all tapas, so go wild on that menu. Drink menu is also fantastic. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the Seaport area!

Good food with amazing service and friendly staff! 
Went their twice, once for dinner and the other time was for brunch. I would say I liked their brunch more. The dinner is tapas style but i would say it is a bit a lot of food.

This place never disappoints. Service is always amazing and the food is exquisite, but it is a small plates kind of place so be prepared to share lots of yummy things. The cocktails are the best and always new options available.

We were very excited to try Committee for the first time, as the reviews were all great and our expectations were high. We secured a table on Friday evening for 19:00 and were hoping for the best. 

We showed up at 18:55 and were told that our table would be ready momentarily. We were seated 15 minutes later, a minor inconvenience as the place was packed. We ordered tapas style, as many of the dishes are meant to be shared with others, and eagerly awaited the first dish. However, instead of a few dishes coming out at once, every single dish we ordered was delivered to us within 5 minutes of each other. The table was crowded, and many of the dishes were hot, but by the time we got to them they were cold. In addition to this annoyance, the bar was extremely crowded, and people were getting rather rowdy for 20:00 on a Friday. The noise level was insane and we barely could hear each other speak. This was further compounded by the loud music also playing. It seems that many come for the bar, rather than the restaurant, which makes it difficult to enjoy your own meal. 

The food was enjoyable and prepared well, but the atmosphere and the bombardment of our dishes ruined it for us. Perhaps we shall try again on a weeknight, and ask for our dishes to be spaced out.

name: Myers+Chang
reviews: This place did not disappoint! Excited to see Joanne Chang behind the bar when we walked in. The balance of flavor in all the dishes we had was outstanding. I wish this was in my hometown so I could try more of the dishes because everything we tried was delicious.

As a person who's dined at Myers and Chang a handful of times I wanted to write about the takeout experience.

The staff who picked up the phone was courteous and was thorough with going through with the order. As I was driving over to pick up my order, I received a friendly reminder that the food was almost ready (which is great to hear). 

Upon picking up the food, I got asked by the staff whether I needed chopsticks and napkins which is also shows great customer service. Finally I must say that the food was delicious even for takeout. It was still warm when I arrived (and I live in Brighton). Also, thank you for the complementary chocolate mousse and the shrimp chips with the order.

Great take out experience and will order in the future.

Great place to visit with a small group and try a lot of different dishes. Mostly lived up to expectations. Some creative and tasty takes on Asian fusion. The crispy salmon rolls were the standout, we called the waitress back for a second order. Tuna poke bowl was nicely spiced and fresh. Cocktails were creative and refreshing on a warm day.

This place is my number one restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. Whenever  I want to go to a proper dinner, this place comes first to my mind. excellent and many types of  food and a rich cuisine.generous staff members, and good vibes. In addition to that, the pay is honest. I suggest this restaurant with no hesitation.

If I could rate 6/5, I would. It's an amazing experience, great service and fantastic food. I sat at the bar and had great conversation with one of the chefs. I ordered half orders of the eggplant, longevity noodles, and scallion pancake, and I couldn't be happier. I took home about half of the food and I'm excited for the leftovers. Highly recommend

name: Marliave
reviews:
Went for a birthday dinner for restaurant week in March. Therefore, we were on a fixed menu. Service was a bit low despite the restaurant being a bit empty but our server was great and energetic once he got to us. 
The appetizers with the escargot and the beef were to die for. They appear to have gone for the cheaper items for the main menu. The duck dish was tasteless but the silver lining is the how accommodating the restaurant was. Upon mentioning the duck dish, they quickly offered to switch it out for another main course item of my preference. the salmon they brought in was very good. flavourful and crispy on one side. The Sunday gravy was quite good as well.
I made the mistake of ordering a cheese board with a chocolate truffle for dessert. Tasty, filling but a bit pricey

Fantastic downtown location, good food and nice cocktails. Technically the founder may have been french in the late 1880s, but the menu is not strongly French. Listing it as a French restaurant seems a bit of a stretch, although we enjoyed everything we ordered.
An incredible restaurant with one of the best cocktail menus in the city. I've been several times and I've never been let down. The staff is always very friendly as well.

At the moment  you step in that restaurant  team give you an excellent feeling. Very congenial stuff, it is a happy place to go out with buddies or with your date. yummy  meals, creative  chief cook and stuff, comfortable  price and attentive  service. Highly recommended.
Everything was amazing. The drinks weren't too strong but enjoyable. Will go back if in the area.

name: Coppa Enoteca
reviews: This is one of the best restaurants in Boston. The atmosphere is good. And the food is awesome. They do really nice cocktails as well. I just want to give them more stars!

Excellent small Italian restaurant in Boston.  The pizza is excellent but you have to get to get the celery Cesar salad.  The swordfish is also excellent.  All of the pasta dishes are very good.  It has a small bar and outdoor seating as well.  Reservations are recommended.

The food, the drink, the space, the people: All excellent. Coppa continues to be pretty close to a perfect restaurant and one of my favorite places in the city.

While a table on the patio is heaven in the South End, my favorite way to enjoy Coppa is sliding up to the bar, grabbing a house Negroni, and enjoying a few smaller dishes, finishing with a pasta.

I've been coming to Coppa for years. Definitely my favorite restaurant in the South End. Delicious food in a cozy atmosphere. The pasta is just sooo good. On second thought...everything is good!! Friendly, accommodating staff. I've recommended this place to countless people. My tip to you: make a reservation!!

Small place, but they do make the most of their room. The charcuterie is pricey but unique options make it worth splurging; duck prosciutto, tongue, beef heart pastrami.. Pizza was very good, but didn't blow my mind. Pasta dish was very good with an interesting mix of ingredients. Try the gelatto with espresso to pour over, fantastic. Pricey, but not outside what is typical for a city location offering an inventive quality menu.

name: Ocean Prime
reviews: Listen!!! I don’t leave reviews but this restaurant has moved its way to my favorite restaurant. It was packed but worth the wait. If you are looking to dress up, and dine in fine style this is where you need to go. The food is simply perfect! My wife doesn’t eat shrimp and she ordered Shrimp Sauté for appetizer and she couldn’t find words to express her love for the dish. She had the two lobster tail to top it off.

Food is a little pricey for what it is - nothing truly amazing or groundbreaking. The ambience is also having an identity crisis - it doesn't know whether it wants to be trendy and hip or classy and modern. It's just a little weird to have to weave through a sea of drunk coeds dancing to live music in order to enjoy some 60+ dollar steak.

I was overall happy with the restaurant. The server was naturally a little rigid.
Food was good, but not top, especially for a luxury place and for they charge.
I ordered Kansas city strip steak. It was cooked to my liking and the first bite tasted great. But then something didn't feel right in subsequent bites. It didn't have enough flavor and the marbling distribution was not good as some bites were tender and others were more chewy.
Double baked potato quickly turned to rubbery texture on the exterior. The interior tasted good though.
Seating was comfortable and there were plenty of seating options to choose from on a weekday around 4pm. 

I would go there again if I'm invited, but I will certainly spend the money in a different steakhouse if I have the option.

Is it a good place? Yes. 

Is it the best ever? No, and far from it. 

The surf & turf was truly excellent. Top 3 in New England. The appetizers and desserts were disappointing and bordering pathetic. Visited on a Saturday for dinner service, so you know the A-team was in the kitchen. 

Coming here was like getting slapped in the face, then given heavenly bliss, followed by another slap in the face. Then paying and saying thank you for the slaps in the face. 

Worth returning exclusively for a main course, skip the rest

I take my kids there regularly, and they all love it. They have a good selection of kids menus, with several different kinds of meats available. They also will bring unlimited dippers for the cheese, so when my youngest wants only bread and carrots, he can enjoy those while the rest of us have the fondue.

name: Sportello
reviews: Very elegant and accessible spot. They offer big portions and for fair rates. I loved the menu a lot and the waiters were very welcoming and explanatory. Recommended.
Really really wonderful pasta.  I had their tagliatelle, and it was superb.  The style of the restaurant is also really neat, with a fully exposed kitchen.  Highly recommended.
Really good! The gnocchi was a little heavy but that was our bad for not expecting it (especially for lunch, whoops). Very very good food.

Came during lunch time and only had to wait around 15 minutes or so. You get to pick your own seats and your order is brought to you. The ambiance inside is really nice! I ordered the breakfast sandwich. The brioche bun was really tasty.
Neighborhood upscale Italian. All pasta made in house. A nice place to drop by, or even eat alone.

name: Teatro
reviews:
I have dined here three times.All excellent experiences. The veal entree was awesome the first two times.
This visit I ordered the chicken parmigiana .It was was without a doubt the best I ever had.

My favorite restaurant!! If I could eat there every day I would. There hasn't been a dish that I haven't loved. I love their calamari, and the muscles are my ultimate favorite. The homemade sorbetto is absolutely delicious!!!
I prefer this restaurant a lot. theres a special air. The cuisine is marvelous. the service is effective and the stuff is well trained. The price is honest. I highly recommend.
Decent food. Decent value. Lobster pasta dish was great. 3.5.

Friendly, courteous and attentive staff. Fun, lively, modern decor. Fresh, bright, well composed flavors. Great experience and we were unrushed as three of us lingered over desserts and another glass of wine.

name: The Barking Crab
reviews: It's a good summer spot to have a bucket of light beers if you're a tourist or after work. The water taxi has a pick up spot at the dock in front of it. So it's a great place to start before taking the boat to another bar. Fun time.

Excellent Market Crab and Lobster.  Fresh oysters were great. You can tell the seafood is fresh here. Great choice if your looking for a local place that isnt a chain. Food receives 5 star. Service was acceptable but lacking. I strongly suggest a cell phone policy for their servers!

Hands-down one of the best restaurants in town for seafood. The ambience is great. The view is beautiful. Super crowded during weekends but the service is on point. A must-try if you are in the area and looking for some seafood. 
Recommendations: Fire-grilled Lobster and Grilled Salmon

Nice cozy place with wood stove in the winter. Excellent fried clam bellies and calamari.  Fast, quick food service. The staff and our server, Jess,  were definitely helpful and friendly. Monetary cost for two persons: 1 app, 2x Entres, 2x Sodas:

First Visit to Boston and this was on my wish list. I was not disappointed. There was a wait but i was able to walk around a bit. The food was delicious and the service was great. I would come again on my next visit. @raulvsfood

name: Maggiano's Little Italy
reviews: This place is incredible I've been here 2 times!! Best Italian food I've had at a restaurant. I wish I remember the 2 waiters names I had both were awesome at their job's. Hopefully when I go there next time I will see them and remember their names. Highly recommend

Food was delicious! Service was great!

Definitely gets busy on a Saturday night. Also they only take walk ins after 8pm so make sure to have a reservation all setup! 

I'd advise trying something new and not going with the good old Fettuccine Alfredo lol

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the team is generous and cooperative. Whenever we eat in this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  highly recommended.

I made valentines day reservation 2 weeks prior. We were seated promptly. Our server was awesome! Food was outstanding. The desert was DELICIOUS. This is my FAVORITE restaurant. Nobody beats the service, food, atmosphere here. I'll be coming here forever.

Why did this not meet up to expectations?
- The restaurant was half empty yet we had to wait for a table. Why?
- The scampi were not that great. You can find much better in Boston!
- The Bolognese had too much cream in the sauce. It's tomato right? Don't make an Italian cry!
- Pasta options for dinner were limited. You can find them in first courses all over Italy. 
- The Bread was so-so. Okay, this is just a side to fill you up. 
Next, pineapple in pizza? This is just getting a very Americanized here.

name: Lincoln Tavern & Restaurant
address: 425 W Broadway, South Boston, MA 02127, USA
reviews: Wow! This place pretty much had it all: delicious food and drinks, friendly service, and a great atmosphere. Our table got Lincoln burgers and they were very well seasoned and cooked exactly as requested. The baked fig and goat cheese was SO good that we were talking about it hours later. Our server was very efficient and friendly, and she made us feel welcome the entire time. Overall I would recommend this tavern to anyone in the South Boston area!!

Great weekday brunch until 3pm! Although the brunch menu is small, it’s exquisite! I highly recommend the breakfast pizza. I also got the shrimp salad and it was definitely big enough to split (so is the pizza). Will definitely be back for the creative drinks and live music in the future!

What an Amazing brunch place! I loved every single bite of it. That is our second time and this time we decided to try the test kitchen (on Friday lunch time) and everything was delicious. I would recommend the breakfast pizza and poutine! If you’re not the test kitchen, I would recommend the California brunch which is a healthy brunch option that is delicious and well made with guacamole and spinach.

If you’re in need of some comfort food, this is the place to be. The food here is absolutely out of this world. By far one of the most amazing food places I’ve been to in Boston. I definitely will be going here a lot more often!

Lincoln’s is a cool, hip tavern with a great brunch. They have unique breakfast options and some classics with a twist. Like their fruity pebbles pancakes! Service seems like it could be nice but our waitress felt a little short.

name: Boston Chops South End
reviews:
I have frequented chops over the last few years and always enjoy their menu.  Ms. Sinclair, a manager at Chops, helped make the evening wonderful for my girlfriend and I as we celebrated and had an evening out.  Everything was amazing and the food was fantastic.  Highly recommend starting off with a seafood tower and moving to one of their prime cuts.  The desserts cannot be skipped over either!

We cannot wait until their brunch specials are back this summer!

I am a huge fan of Chef Chris Combs! He's a local favorite and has four restaurants in total. Two Boston Chops location, Deuxave, and. dbar; which I have tried all and really love the effort he and his team puts in to the whole experience. I highly recommend visiting!

This site is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. everytime  I feel like having a decent lunch, this restaurant comes right away to my head. good and varied  food and a large list of dishes.great team, and great ambience. And very important, the pay is modest. I suggest this place with great pleasure.

I have been to Boston Shop, South End for many times.  It’s one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. The service is good and the food is great, but it’s not a cheap restaurant. Get your wallet ready if you decide to eat there, it could cost up to $100-300 just for two people to get the decent dinner meal.  However the food is really delicious. Worth the cost anyway. Try their deserts as well. Really delicious! They’re always busy, Make a reservation if it’s needed.

Steak lovers rejoice! This place is amazing. The servers here go above and beyond to make sure your experience is nothing less than exceptional. Also can’t go wrong with their bottomless fries as a side with your meal.

name: Mooo....
reviews:
I came here to celebrate my dear friend's birthday given he really loves good quality steak. One of my coworkers only eat Kosher steak so we needed to find a place that serves it. Thankfully Moooo... had it. 

I was touched by the fact that they prepared a paper menu with my friend's name and saying "happy birthday". It was very thoughtful of them to have it prepared.

I got the rib eye steak, which was beautifully cooked (medium rare). We also got the wild mushroom and creamed spinach for our sides, which were very tasty. We finished our meal with a great rich chocolate cake, which was very memorable. 

Overall, it is a very nice place to have a great steak meal to celebrate a special occasion. I will highly recommend this place.

Food was very good as was service. The wine list was one of the best I have ever seen. However, it was one of the most overpriced wine lists I have ever seen. If you want a good bottle with your meal try elsewhere unless sticker shock is okay.

Nice food, great service, could be better

For $200+ per person, one expects an amazing meal and we got something close but not quite there....

We got the attention: service was amazing, table size quite generous, sound proofing great, nice plates, nice linen, very prompt seating, great acknowledgement of birthday (it was on the personalized menu!)

Food was good but not perfect: oysters were great, brioche bread was warm, bone marrow generous, steak was "fine" but I've had better at other fancy steak houses, sides were meh- on par with Boston market, dumplings with beef were same as any good Chinese restaurant (but 5x price), dessert was cute but the banana foster we make at home is better. Drinks were ok- we don't drink wine so their amazing wine list was lost in us.....

If I shell out that kind of money for a diiner- I want to remember it for a LONG time and it is already fading......

Pros: Quiet. Great oysters. Bone marrow is excellent. I had the dry aged rib eye, and it was meltingly good. House steak sauce is nice and vinegary. Bread rolls are rich and fluffy, bordering on brioche but more like Parker House. Portions are generous, so come hungry.  

Cons: Oyster mushroom side was low on seasoning. Check came before we asked for it. Chocolate covered marshmallow that came with the bill was a disappointing final note to the meal. Entree was placed in front of the wrong guest. Bananas in the bananas Foster were firm (although they had a nice crisp caramelized layer). Not usually a big deal, but at this price point my standards are high.
Definitely not for the faintest of wallets but atmosphere and service excellent. Steaks we ordered were cooked to perfection. Pleasant staff and wide selection of wine, spirits and other drinks.

name: The Daily Catch
reviews: I've seen so many places like this on shows and movies. This is a true quaint little spot with amazing seafood. Loved the menu. The wait staff was great. The dishes were the right size and packed with flavor. I also enjoyed that they have appetizer portions for their pasta dishes.

The restaurant is very small but cozy. It is first come first serve and you can't save seats, so make sure to have everyone in your party there on time to be seated. We had calamari for appertizer. The calamari was great, just right amount of breading. Nice flavor. Very light. I had The shrimp linguine. And it was amazing! The linguine was cooked perfectly. The sauce was great. The people that were seating next to me ordered the lobster pasta, and it smelled so good. Service was fast. Small menu but seems like they nail everything. Cash only.
Great food in a cozy atmosphere.  Kitchen is right next to dining area.  Highly recommend but there is a wait line.  Go during off hours between lunch and dinner to avoid the wait.

DO NOT WORRY ABOUT THE WAIT TIME!!! We waited for 45 minutes in line and it was worth it. If it wasn't for people spending their time taking pictures inside we would have been in quicker. Once you're inside, it's small and cozy and it smells fantastic. The staff were very friendly. Service was quick. The food was fantastic!! Everything was fresh and the black ink pasta is delicious. It is cash only! Highly recommend!.

Worth the wait...great North End Italian experience.

I came here with my cousins who had been here before and insisted it was worth the wait. I'm not a huge pasta person and I had my reservations waiting for a place that has only maybe 20 seats and doesn't take reservations. I was pleasantly surprised.

Food: some of the best pasta I've had in my life. Must get the homemade squid ink pasta with ground squid, garlic and olive oil. Then had linguine in white wine sauce with mussels. Add a side of broccoli and that was enough for the 3 of us. Extra authentic points for them serving the pasta in the pans they are cooked in.

Ambiance: tight and busy. This place is tiny and the kitchen is right there in the dining room so you can see everything. This is a true gritty experience.

Our waiter was part of the family that owns the restaurant and it was great hearing about their history and plans for the future. This place is the real deal. Can't wait to go back for the squid ink pasta
